live_updates.title: SUPER 6 RETURNS - £1,000,000 'TIL IT'S WON!
live_updates.author: Lewis Jones
live_updates.text:
Super 6 is back, and we’re guaranteeing a millionaire by the end of October to start the season.
Simply download the app or head to the website to enter your predictions for free!
If there is no winner of the £1m by the conclusion of round nine, the
SEASON LEADER
will walk away a million pounds richer!
Play for free by Saturday 16th August – 3pm deadline.

live_updates.title: Become the Super 6 champion!
live_updates.author: Lewis Jones
live_updates.text:
Just ONE week to go until Super 6 returns alongside the Premier League.
And, if you finish at the top of the Super 6 season leaderboard at the end of the season, you will take home £10,000!
No league code required, just check your position on the season leaderboard tab and enter as many rounds as possible to give yourself the best possible chance of winning the league!

live_updates.title: Super 6: 100 Club!
live_updates.author: Lewis Jones
live_updates.text:
Prizes are awarded to 100 or fewer players who have predicted a shocking scoreline.
One player out of 800,000 correctly predicted PSV 1-7 Arsenal last season to win £10,000! Predict the unpredictable to earn a place in the 100 Club.

live_updates.title: Top Scorer wins up to £6,000!
live_updates.author: Lewis Jones
live_updates.text:
The player who finishes the round as the Top Scorer will win up to £6,000 every weekend (£1,000 for midweek rounds) if there is no jackpot winner!
SUPER 6 returns - £1,000,000 ‘TIL IT’S WON!

live_updates.title: NO WINNER LAST WEEK, SO...£1,000,000 'TIL IT'S WON!
live_updates.author: Lewis Jones
live_updates.text:
Over ONE MILLION Super 6 players entered the opening round of Super 6, with new-found optimism of landing the £1,000,000 start of season jackpot at the first attempt.
Sunderland had other ideas, as their 3-0 win over West Ham knocked out over 98% of the field, with just 1,337 players correctly predicting that scoreline (well done you)!
Fear not, the £1,000,000 is on the line until it’s won and if it isn’t claimed by the ninth round of the campaign, the season leader will walk away with the lot!
Simply download the app or head to the website to enter your predictions for free!
Get your entries in by 3pm Saturday, good luck.

live_updates.title: Super 6: Alex from Warwickshire two goals away from £1m!
live_updates.author: Lewis Jones
live_updates.text:
Round 2 saw another ONE MILLION Super 6 hopefuls with the £1,000,000 jackpot up for grabs again!
Although 34 per cent of players nailed Crystal Palace’s 1-1 draw with Forest on Sunday, by the end of Saturday’s action - including Brentford’s shock win over Aston Villa – just two players were still in the hunt for the million.
The closest after all six games? Alex from Warwickshire, who correctly predicted an incredible five correct scorelines!
Only Arsenal’s 5-0 victory against Leeds stood between him and millionaire status after he predicted a 3-0 win.
Still, Alex walked away £6,000 as our Top Scorer after those five spot-on predictions.
We’re back again this weekend with another million pounds on the line –
get your entries in by 3pm Saturday, good luck!

live_updates.title: Essential Football: Champions League final fall-out - where next for PSG and Inter?
live_updates.author: Ron Walker
live_updates.text: Ron Walker is in Munich’s Marienplatz with Sky Sports journalists Adam Bate and Declan Olley the morning after the Champions League final, to look back at PSG’s dominant victory over Inter Milan. We discuss if this is a start of PSG dominance and ask what next for Inter and manager Simone Inzaghi.

live_updates.title: LISTEN: Henry Winter features on the latest episode of Transfer Talk!
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
A new episode of the Transfer Talk podcast has just dropped!
Sky Sports
duo
Pete Graves
and
Dharmesh Sheth
are joined by football journalist
Henry Winter
to discuss Liverpool closing in on the signing of
Florian Wirtz
, in what could be a British transfer record.
Also discussed is the future of
Andy Robertson
, with the left-back linked to Atletico Madrid amid the potential arrival of
Milos Kerkez
from Bournemouth.
With
Viktor Gyokeres
reportedly deciding against a move to Manchester United, what does that say about the appeal of Old Trafford?
Thomas Frank has had an instant impact at Spurs with the arrival of
Mathys Tel
, and Arsenal appear to be nearing the end of their long search for a striker, but will it be Gyokeres or
Benjamin Sesko
?

live_updates.title: Pitch to Pod - Lionesses takeover!
live_updates.author: Patrick Rowe
live_updates.text:
A new episode of the Pitch to Pod podcast has just dropped - live from the Lionesses media day!
Caroline Barker and Juliette Ferrington takeover a very special England media day ahead of Euro 2025... getting all the gossip from the squad members themselves and finding out how they're preparing to try and retain the trophy this summer...

live_updates.title: Pitch to Pod: Lionesses champions AGAIN!
live_updates.author: Peter Smith
live_updates.text:
What a tournament! England are now back-to-back European champions as they beat Spain 3-1 on penalties!
Nikita can't join us this week so Jordan gives us her reaction straight after another huge history-making night for the Lionesses.
Jordan gives us all the analysis on the nail-biting 90 minutes then into extra time which had everyone on the edge of their seats. Then... the penalties... and we don't think Jordan has quite recovered yet!
She also looks at just how inspirational this England team is and the importance of young talent.

live_updates.title: Sky Sports Fantasy: Consider using Bench Boost chip in Gameweek 1
live_updates.author: Charlotte Marsh
live_updates.text:
James Savundra
and
Mark Briggs
are joined by FPL expert
Gianni Buttice
for this week’s episode of the Sky Sports Fantasy Podcast.
James, Mark and Gianni are on hand to help you build the best squad for the first week of the season and they explain why you should consider using your Bench Boost chip in Gameweek 1.
They also discuss the best captaincy options and reveal their latest drafts.

live_updates.title: Transfer Talk: How does Benjamin Sesko fit in at Man Utd?
live_updates.author: Ron Walker
live_updates.text:
Speaking on the
Transfer Talk
podcast,
Sam Tighe
joins
Dharmesh Sheth
and
Pete Graves
to explain how
Benjamin Sesko
slots in alongside
Bryan Mbeumo
and
Matheus Cunha
in Ruben Amorim's system at Manchester United.
Also on this week's round-up of the biggest transfer news:
How Sesko’s move to Old Trafford impacts the future of
Alexander Isak
The future of
Yoane Wissa
at Brentford
Heung-min Son
completing his move to the MLS
Chelsea's chase of
Xavi Simons
and
Alejandro Garnacho
Everton sign
Kiernan Dewsbury-Hall
and want
Jack Grealish
Aston Villa's deal for Nice forward
Evann Guessand
The latest on
Eberechi Eze
to Arsenal

live_updates.title: PODCAST: Neville: Man Utd need to fix 'glaring' issue | Who are genuine title contenders? Who showed they can beat the drop?
live_updates.author: Charlotte Marsh
live_updates.text:
In
Gary Neville's
first podcast of the new 2025/26 season, he reacts to
Arsenal's
1-0 win against
Man Utd
at Old Trafford.
Neville is adamant that Manchester United need to sign a new goalkeeper in the summer transfer window.
He also lauds the performance of a new Man City signing after their resounding win against Wolves.
Neville backs one team to beat the drop by stating they demonstrated the qualities to achieve Premier League survival in their first match of the season.
Neville also believes there are three teams that all have genuine cases to be Premier League title contenders this season.

live_updates.title: Guardiola on the pressure of last season, why he's easy to work with and seeing Oasis!
live_updates.author: Peter Smith
live_updates.text:
One on One
from
Sky Sports
returns for the new
Premier League
season!
Joe Thomlinson
and
Juliette Ferrington
are back with the podcast that takes you inside training grounds for candid one-on-one interviews with some of the biggest names in football.
In our first episode of series two, Jules sits down with the
Manchester City
manager,
Pep Guardiola
, who opens up about the pressures of last season, how playing in the Club World Cup could actually help his team this campaign, his new-look backroom staff and seeing Oasis!

live_updates.title: LISTEN: Moyes on One on One Podcast
live_updates.author: Peter Smith
live_updates.text:
David Moyes
discusses
Everton's
new stadium, what it's like to be a manager during the transfer window, his impressions of new signing
Jack Grealish
and why you never stop learning in football on the One on One Podcast.
Listen to his chat with
Sky Sports'
Juliette Ferrington
here...

live_updates.title: Parris back on Pitch to Pod to talk London City Lionesses!
live_updates.author: Peter Smith
live_updates.text:
Pitch to Pod
is back and we kick off with a special episode from London City Lionesses' media day.
We catch up with our pal Nikita Parris and her team-mates Kosovare Asllani, Poppy Pattinson and Sanni Frassni.
They tell us what it's like inside the London City project and how a mix of experience and young talent will make them a tough side to beat in the WSL.

live_updates.title: Harsh decision to award penalty against Dewsbury-Hall?
live_updates.author: Dan Long
live_updates.text:
INCIDENT:
Brighton win a penalty at Everton. The Premier League Match Centre says Kiernan Dewsbury-Hall made himself unjustifiably bigger. He’s so close to the shot, isn't this harsh?
DERMOT SAYS:
"It is harsh, but it is the rule.
"If you look at it, his arm is out. It hits his arm. It's a shot on goal, so it's always going to be punished.
"Once your arm is up that high, it's always going to be given."
JAY BOTHROYD SAYS
: "I don't think that is an unnatural position, to be honest. His hand is close to his body. If his hand is out and it hits his hand then I would say definitely.
"It shouldn't be a penalty in my eyes because all he's done is try to block a shot. You don't think about where your hands are, but his hand is still close to his chest."

live_updates.title: Will keepers now start going down after Martinez earns foul at Villa?
live_updates.author: Peter Smith
live_updates.text:
INCIDENT:
Brentford's Mikkel Damsgaard scored to make it 2-0 against Aston Villa, but it was ruled out.
A post on the Premier League Match Centre on X said: "The referee’s call of no goal following a foul by Nathan Collins on Emi Martinez was checked and confirmed by VAR - with it deemed that Collins carelessly challenged the goalkeeper."
DERMOT SAYS:
"Not many people expected a foul there. It's not what I'd call a clear foul.
"The referee gives a foul, that's his choice. The problem is, when the VAR looks at it, you see him go into Martinez."
JAY BOTHROYD SAYS:
"The whole time, Collins is looking at the ball. There's been contact. Last week, Bayindir stayed on his feet [against Arsenal] and he got punished for that one. When you look at Martinez, same thing but he's just gone down.
"If Martinez had stayed on his feet, he wouldn't have got it."

live_updates.title: Should Arsenal's penalty have been awarded?
live_updates.author: Dan Long
live_updates.text:
INCIDENT:
Arsenal wonderkid Max Dowman wins a penalty after going down under minimal contact from Leeds' Anton Stach in the box.
DERMOT SAYS:
"This is where we have a problem, isn't it?
"In isolation, we can discuss this, but when you piece it together, one after the other like this, there's no doubt there is much more contact in the Man City game than there is here.
"He does make contact; he just steps on his foot."
JAY BOTHROYD SAYS
: "When you're moving at speed, the smallest clip or touch can stifle you and you will go down.
"But the Oscar Bobb one, there's much more contact on that one - and the defender in this one hasn't really lunged, he's just put his foot in the wrong position, which has caught Dowman."

live_updates.title: Should Timber's second have been ruled out?
live_updates.author: Dan Long
live_updates.text:
INCIDENT:
The ball hit William Saliba's arm in the build-up to Jurrien Timber's second goal. We're told if the ball touches the attacker's hand in creating a goal it won't count. So explain this one...
DERMOT SAYS:
"I'm not convinced it hits his hand, but if it does, it's accidental. And because he's not the scorer, he can't be penalised.
"If it does strike his arm or his hand and he scores, it's disallowed."
JAY BOTHROYD SAYS:
"Because both players are so close together, even if it does hit his hand, I think it's harsh to not give that goal.
"Both players are going for it and it's there - it's going to hit someone's arm because it's so high.
"If he moves his hand onto the ball, that's different."

live_updates.title: 'If that was the deciding decision, there'd be uproar!' Split on Trafford call
live_updates.author: Peter Smith
live_updates.text:
INCIDENT:
The ball hits Man City keeper James Trafford's arm outside the box, why isn't it given as handball?
DERMOT SAYS:
"The ball can hit his arm accidentally."
JAY BOTHROYD SAYS:
"Whether it's accidentaly or not, if it doesn't hit his arm, Mohammed Kudus goes through and scores. It's still stopping a goal-scoring opportunity."
INCIDENT:
If it's not handball, should he have been punished for the high challenge on Kudus?
JAY BOTHROYD SAYS:
"I thought he was going off. His knee is really high, Kudus could have got really hurt. And the fact it's hit his arm, Kudus is going to have a tap-in for the goal."
DERMOT SAYS:
"You can justify the ball hitting his arm but his challenge is probably the worst of the two."
JAY BOTHROYD SAYS:
"How can you justify the ball hitting his arm?!"
DERMOT SAYS:
"He has to handle the ball deliberately. The second part is the grey area, because if the referee gives a foul, he's off."
JAY BOTHROYD SAYS:
"It's lucky Tottenham won this game because if that was the deciding decision, there'd be big uproar.
Who cares if it's accidental or not, the handball. It's stopped a goal-scoring opportunity!

live_updates.title: Man City denied penalty vs Spurs
live_updates.author: Peter Smith
live_updates.text:
INCIDENT:
Micky van de Ven catches Oscar Bobb in the area but no penalty is awarded. City go on to lose the game 2-0.
DERMOT SAYS:
One of the clues is the player stretching. He stands on his foot. The referee gives no foul. What didn't help her case was at Arsenal there was a lesser contact and a foul was given.
JAY BOTHROYD SAYS:
Van de Ven has lunged - and when you lunge and make contact, it's definitely a penalty.

live_updates.title: Everton sign Dibling from Southampton in £42m deal
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Everton
have completed the signing of teenage winger
Tyler Dibling
from
Southampton
in a £42m deal.
Sky Sports News
understands the deal includes £6m worth of easily achievable add-ons and a 20 per cent sell-on clause.
The 19-year-old has signed a four-year deal at the Toffees.
Dibling becomes David Moyes' eighth new signing of the summer transfer window, following the arrivals of Thierno Barry, Jack Grealish, Carlos Alcaraz, Mark Travers, Kiernan Dewsbury-Hall, Adam Aznou and Tom King.
Dibling's arrival takes the Toffees' spending to £124m this summer.

live_updates.title: Coleman left out of Ireland squad for World Cup qualifiers
live_updates.author: David Richardson
live_updates.text:
Everton
captain
Seamus Coleman
has not been named in the
Republic of Ireland
squad for the start of their World Cup qualification campaign against Hungary and Armenia next month.

live_updates.title: Everton's right-back shortlist revealed amid Patterson loan exit
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Lyall Thomas:
Everton
have agreed loan terms with
Sevilla
for
Nathan Patterson
.
However, the Merseyside club want to secure a replacement before the deal can progress.
Everton have been in the market for a new right-back all summer and most likely to secure someone on loan.
Lyon’s Ainsley Maitland-Niles
,
Barcelona’s Hector Fort
and
Norwich’s Kellen Fisher
are among the players they have been looking at.

live_updates.title: LISTEN: Moyes on One on One Podcast
live_updates.author: Peter Smith
live_updates.text:
David Moyes
discusses
Everton's
new stadium, what it's like to be a manager during the transfer window, his impressions of new signing
Jack Grealish
and why you never stop learning in football on the One on One Podcast.
Listen to his chat with
Sky Sports'
Juliette Ferrington
here...

live_updates.title: Moyes: I've got no defenders
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
David Moyes
has suggested defensive reinforcements could be on the agenda as
Everton
consider further business before next week's transfer deadline.
Injuries to
Jarrad Branthwaite
,
Nathan Patterson
,
Seamus Coleman
and
Vitalii Mykolenko
have limited Moyes' options in the opening weeks of the new season.
Veteran captain Coleman and Mykolenko were eased back into action with starts in Wednesday's comfortable 2-0 Carabao Cup defeat of League One Mansfield at the Hill Dickinson Stadium.
Moyes, however, still feels short in the department and decided he could not afford to rest senior centre-backs James Tarkowski and Michael Keane for what was a straightforward assignment against lower-division opposition.
The Toffees manager said: "We wanted to try and give as many players [as possible] a game. I've not got any defenders. I'm very limited to what I can choose defensive-wise.
"It already has changed a lot of my plans because, obviously, we're without Jarrad and we have been without Myko for, certainly, the first couple of games.
"We had this at the end of last season as well, we've had it all through the summer. It's not as if we've necessarily got it better.
"We've got people back, but others are injured. We've just got to make sure that we're not short again if we can help it - and certainly we were short for the first two games in the Premier League."

live_updates.title: Rangers enquire over Chermiti
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Vinny O'Connor and Sahil Jaidka:
Rangers
have made contact with
Everton
over a loan deal for striker
Youssef
Chermiti
.
The 21-year-old is well known by Ibrox sporting director Kevin Thelwell, who helped sign him for the Premier League club in 2023 from Sporting Lisbon in a deal worth around £15m.
Chermiti has been impacted by various injuries and made just 24 appearances for Everton, is yet to score and is on the search for regular game time.

live_updates.title: Moyes backs Grealish to rediscover form at Everton
live_updates.author: Charlotte Marsh
live_updates.text:
David Moyes
has backed
Jack Grealish
to rediscover his best form and fire
Everton
to a third consecutive victory against Wolves on Saturday.
The Man City loanee provided both goals in Everton’s 2-0 win against Brighton last weekend and also played an hour in the Toffees’ 2-0 Carabao Cup triumph against Mansfield.
Moyes said: “He is a real talent and someone we’re hoping can get back to the levels he’s produced before.
“He’s helped us already and I hope we can continue to build on it, get him fitter, stronger and used to playing again.”
Injuries to
Jarrad Branthwaite, Nathan Patterson, Seamus Coleman
and
Vitalii Mykolenko
have limited Moyes’ defensive options in the opening weeks of the new season.
And with deadline day fast approaching, the Everton boss said: “We could make more signings but I don’t want to raise all the expectations all the time.
“Whether we get anything over the line by Monday night, I couldn’t be sure of that yet.”
Mykolenko played in the cup victory against Mansfield and could be handed his first league start of the season by Moyes. However, Branthwaite, Patterson and new recruit
Adam Aznou
will continue to be absent.

live_updates.title: Moyes: Grealish better than I thought
live_updates.author: Adam Bate
live_updates.text:
Given that three Everton players were among the scorers in their
3-2 win over Wolves at Molineux
, Kiernan Dewsbury-Hall picking up an assist to go along with his fine goal, some might be surprised to see Jack Grealish named player of the match again but he just stands out.
He assisted two of the goals, taking his tally for the season to four – which is already double that of his past two seasons at Manchester City. Playing regularly again, it would be no great shock if he tops the Premier League rankings at the end of the season.
But it was the goal for which he was not directly involved that most obviously showcased his brilliance. Having been denied by Jose Sa moments earlier, his vision sent Dewsbury-Hall in behind to set up Iliman Ndiaye to find the back of the net. Class.
Asked about Grealish’s improvement, David Moyes said: “Well, it's nothing to do with me, let me tell you, it's all to do with Jack and his own mentality to be better.” He added: “The biggest compliment I can probably give him is he is better than I thought he was.”

live_updates.title: Ramazani set for Valencia loan
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Zinny Boswell:
Leeds United
winger
Largie Ramazani
is expected to join
Valencia
on loan.
Ramazani was left out of Daniel Farke's squad for Saturday's 5-0 defeat at Arsenal amid talks with the Spanish club.
The 24-year-old, who has three years left on his Leeds contract, was also an unused substitute for Leeds' Premier League opener against Everton.
Ramazani has struggled for game-time at Leeds since joining last August from Spanish side Almeria.  He has not started a league match for the club since suffering an injury in October 2024.
Leeds are still in the market for attacking players - having already added Noah Okafor from AC Milan in an £18m deal earlier this week - which could further limit his minutes.
Ramazani will be working under former West Brom and Huddersfield boss Carlos Corberan if the deal goes through without a hitch.

live_updates.title: Leeds sign defender Justin from Leicester in £10m deal
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Leeds
have signed defender
James Justin
from
Leicester
in a £10m deal.
The Whites will pay an initial £8m fee plus £2m in add-ons for the 27-year-old, who has signed a four-year deal at Elland Road.
Justin becomes Leeds' 10th signing this summer and takes the club's spending beyond the £100m mark.
“Obviously to join a club of this size and to have the history it has had, and being back in the Premier League was a massive thing for me, so I’m over the moon to have joined,” James told the club’s official website.
“Everyone that I’ve spoken to about the club and the area has had great things to say about it. So I’m excited to join the lads and get to work.
“The stadium has obviously got one of the best atmospheres in world football.
“And it’s always a daunting task to come here as an opposing team, but I’m happy to have the fans behind me this time.”
Sky Sports News
understands Leicester are satisfied with the deal because Justin had only one year left on his Foxes contract.
The Championship side would have demanded a much higher price if he had longer on his contract.

live_updates.title: 'Three chances!' - Farke assesses DCL debut
live_updates.author: Patrick Rowe
live_updates.text:
Leeds United
boss
Daniel Farke
is happy
Dominic Calvert-Lewin
is in a position to miss chances for his new side despite lacking match fitness.
Calvert-Lewin missed three chances from close range on his debut for the Whites and cannoned his penalty in the shoot-out over the bar, as Leeds bowed out of the Carabao Cup against Sheffield Wednesday.
“Three chances he had during the game, normally he scores two. I am happy he has the chances," Farke said to
Sky Sports
.
“For him, it’s like a pre-season. He needed the minutes to build up his fitness. We are not happy with the outcome but there were more things to think about, some players needed a rest after a busy start.
“Now, we concentrate on the Premier League. Sometimes if you don’t score the goals, you have to accept that the other team wins the game.”

live_updates.title: Leeds full-back set for Bundesliga move
live_updates.author: joeshread
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Zinny Boswell:
Leeds
full-back
Isaac Schmidt
is set to join
Werder Bremen
on a season-long loan.
A deal has been agreed between the clubs that includes an option to buy for around £3.5m.
Schmidt is expected to arrive in Germany on Friday to finalise the move and undergo a medical.
Leeds were waiting to sign a replacement before letting Schmidt go - and have now brought in James Justin.

live_updates.title: Leeds agree mutual departure for Bamford
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Leeds United
and
Patrick Bamford
have reached a mutual agreement for the striker to leave the club this summer.
Earlier this summer, Whites boss
Daniel Farke told Bamford he is "not part" of his plans this season.
Bamford would have been training with the under-21 squad if he remained at the club.

live_updates.title: Leeds advancing in Buonanotte pursuit
live_updates.author: Charlotte Marsh
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Elliot Cook:
Leeds United
have advanced in their pursuit of
Brighton
attacking midfielder
Facundo Buonanotte.
Brighton have been keen for the 20-year-old to go on loan to an English club to gain more experience after his spell at Leicester last season.
Bounanotte fits the profile of player Leeds have been looking for as they try to bolster their creative options in the final third.
The Argentina international, who has been attracting interest from Champions League clubs, can play as a No 10 and on the right wing.
Buonanotte's departure from Brighton would be a straight loan with no obligation involved in the deal.
Sky Germany
reported earlier in the window that Dortmund had made a loan offer for the player.

live_updates.title: Okafor doubtful for Newcastle game
live_updates.author: Charlotte Marsh
live_updates.text:
Leeds
forward
Noah Okafor
is a doubt for Saturday’s visit of
Newcastle.
Okafor, who arrived at Elland Road in the summer in an £18m move from AC Milan, felt a pain in his groin after Tuesday’s Carabao Cup defeat to Sheffield Wednesday.
Boss Daniel Farke said: “He’s more or less the only player who came out of Sheffield Wednesday with a few doubts.
“We spoke about groin problems. He’s more or less the only major doubt.”
Okafor has impressed his new manager since arriving but Farke says there is more to come.
“There were glimpses of his class against Arsenal,” said Farke. “He was in good situations, had a great chance and should have scored with one chance.
“He showed he is capable of beating defenders with pace, creativity, strength, and dribbling. Solid start but space for improvement.”

live_updates.title: Farke: If we can keep up this points tally, I'll organise my own bus tour next summer
live_updates.author: Charlotte Marsh
live_updates.text:
Leeds manager
Daniel Farke
joked that he will organise his own bus tour in celebration if his team keep up their current points tally.
On their Premier League return, Leeds have earned four points from three games after drawing 0-0 with Newcastle on
Saturday Night Football.
He to
Sky Sports
: "I'm a happy man. Four points out of three really competitive games, two games here at home, two clean sheets. This is how you need to approach a new season, a newly promoted side, to be difficult to beat.
"We have played here today against one of the best sides in the Premier League, a side who has dominated on Monday [against Liverpool] with 11, but also with 10 men. We were pretty competitive and it was a tight game.
"We made it difficult for Newcastle to have chances. This is always the base, and the next steps will follow, but I didn't expect that we would come right now.
"If we can keep this points average then I will organise my own bus tour next summer.
"We want to be the first side who breaks this curse of getting relegated as a newly promoted side more or less early in February and March, and we're on a good path right now.
"But it's a long road and we have to win many more points… we keep our foot on the gas and we have to keep going."

live_updates.title: Former captain Brownhill considers huge Saudi offer
live_updates.author: Patrick Rowe
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' James Savundra:
Former
Burnley
midfielder
Josh Brownhill
is considering a huge offer from Saudi Pro League club
Al Shabab
.
Brownhill has held lengthy discussions with head coach Imanol Alguacil regarding a potential move to the Saudi Arabian side.
The club - recently managed by Wolves boss
Vitor Pereira
- are looking to add Brownhill to their ranks as they bid for a title push this season.
It is believed that Al Shabab are willing to offer Brownhill a salary of more than £100,000 a week.
Since deciding to bring to an end to his time at Burnley - having turned down a new contract - the 29-year-old has had interest from the Premier League and Championship.
Brownhill was named in the PFA Championship team of the year last week after scoring 18 goals from midfield in Burnley’s promotion campaign.
The former Clarets captain is thought to be relaxed about his next steps as he is arguably one of the most attractive free agents in the market and can sign outside of the transfer window.

live_updates.title: Burnley show interest in Florentino
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Italy's Luca Bendoni and Sky Sports News' Dharmesh Sheth:
Burnley
are interested in Benfica midfielder
Florentino Luis.
Marseille and Roma have also shown interest in him this summer.
Burnley are still looking to strengthen in four positions, but their preference is to bring players in on loan or on free transfers.
The positions they are still looking at are centre-back, right-back, central-midfield and striker.

live_updates.title: Parker: We go to Man Utd with full belief against a wounded animal in an uncomfortable place
live_updates.author: William Bitibiri
live_updates.text:
Burnley
boss
Scott Parker
says his side will take full belief to Old Trafford as they take on a
Manchester United
side in an uncomfortable place.
The Clarets make the trip to Old Trafford to face a United side fresh of a humiliating Carabao Cup exit at the hands of League Two Grimsby Town.
United were beaten on penalties after leaving it late to claw back a two-goal deficit at Blundell Park.
Asked about the prospect of facing United, Parker said:
"There’s noise around every club. The noise can sometimes be blown u,p and sometimes that narrative can be set by anything it needs to be set by, and the magnitude can make things bigger.
"There’s no doubt at this present moment in time that Man Utd and Amorim are in a place that is uncomfortable for them, but we are playing against a world-class team on their day, it’s a team that can cause you problems.
"They’ve got exceptional players and ones that can change a game at any moment.
"The ups and downs and the bumps of football bring different results sometimes. But we are under no illusions about the task we have ahead of us.
"We go in there with full belief that we can perform to our level, to what we need to be to get a result. I don’t really look into whether it’s good moments or bad moments.
"There are flip sides to it. You can look at one side of it and say it’s a bit of a wounded animal with world-class players that can obviously have a reaction. On the other side, there may be a bit of edginess. Fundamentally, we’ll try to give our best version."

live_updates.title: Burnley agree deal for Benfica's Luis
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Dharmesh Sheth and Luca Bendo
Burnley
have agreed a deal in principle with
Benfica
for midfielder
Florentino Luis
.
The deal is a loan plus an obligation to buy, with the total fee believed to be worth £21.6m (€25m).
There is still work to do as no agreement on the player side yet.

live_updates.title: Parker unsure if it's a good time to face crisis-hit Man Utd
live_updates.author: Charlotte Marsh
live_updates.text:
Burnley
boss
Scott Parker
does not know whether it is a good time to play
Manchester United.
United have been flung into an early-season crisis after their  Carabao Cup exit to Grimsby on Wednesday, which comes on the back of a two-game winless start to the Premier League season.
The Clarets go to Old Trafford on Saturday where they could either face a reaction or take advantage of some nerves.
“There’s always noise around every team. I understand that, sometimes that noise can be blown up,” Parker said.
“There’s no doubt that Man Utd are in a place that is an uncomfortable place.
“The ups and downs and the bumps of football sometimes bring different results, of course. But we’re under no illusions of the task we have ahead of us at the weekend.
“I don’t really look into whether it’s a good or a bad time to go there. There’s always flip sides to that. You can look at one side of it and say, it’s a bit of a wounded animal with world-class players that can obviously have a reaction.
“On the other side, of course, there may be a bit of edginess, but fundamentally, we’ll try and give our best version and take on the task of going to play Manchester United at Old Trafford.”

live_updates.title: Report: Fernandes rescues Man Utd as they scrape past Burnley
live_updates.author: William Bitibiri
live_updates.text:
Bruno Fernandes
scored a dramatic 96th-minute penalty as
Manchester United
scraped past
Burnley
3-2 in a game that
Ruben Amorim
had called a "must win".

live_updates.title: Parker: VAR is making football sterile
live_updates.author: Lewis Jones
live_updates.text:
Scott Parker on the intervention of VAR to award the decisive spot-kick for a tug by Jaidon Anthony on Amad Diallo in Burnley's defeat at Manchester United:
"It's the way the game is going. It's going to become the most sterile game there is. We're probably months or a year away from not celebrating goals.
"I stand on the touchline, you score a goal and I feel like there's a million things go through your mind, a checklist, was it offside? Did he step on his toe two minutes before? We need to get a computer out."

live_updates.title: Arsenal confirm 17 fans banned for abuse
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Arsenal have confirmed they banned seventeen      supporters for abusive and discriminatory behaviour last season.
The club have said it continues a year-on-year decrease from the 31 supporters banned in the 2022-23 season and the 24 supporters banned in the 2023-24 campaign.
Out of the seventeen fans last season, six were for online abuse. And out of the 11 in-stadium offences, two were for racism.
Arsenal have announced they will continue to work with Signify Group to support their efforts in combatting online abuse.
Arsenal Managing Director Richard Garlick said in a statement: “Abusive and discriminatory behaviour has no place at our club.
“Whilst we know that it often comes from a small minority, that will not stop us from acting against abusers who are identified as Arsenal season ticket holders or members and escalating these incidents to law enforcement where appropriate.
“We will continue to take swift and decisive action to tackle abuse of any kind as we continue to build a home where everyone feels safe and welcome.”

live_updates.title: Kane hat-trick, Diaz goal on Bundesliga debut and Olise double - Bayern beat Leipzig
live_updates.author: Patrick Rowe
live_updates.text:
Harry Kane
scored a hat trick as
Bayern Munich
started its Bundesliga title defence with a 6-0 demolition of Leipzig.
The Bavarian powerhouse dominated with the exception of a 15-minute spell after half-time when Antonio Nusa went close for the visitors.
Nusa, who also had a goal ruled out, served to only rile more goals from Kane, who was supported by the outstanding
Michael Olise
, who scored two, and
Luis Diaz
, who got the other goal and set up two on his Bundesliga debut.
"We wanted to come out with a statement and that's exactly what we done," Kane told
Sky Sports
.
"Leipzig are a good side but today we was on top in all areas and we was clinical when we needed to be, so we can enjoy this."

live_updates.title: Ronaldo scores 100th Al Nassr goal in cup final loss
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Cristiano Ronaldo
scored his 100th goal for
Al Nassr b
ut missed the chance to claim silverware as his side were beaten on penalties by
Al Ahli
in a thrilling Saudi Super Cup final in Hong Kong.
The 40-year-old put Al-Nassr in front with a penalty and his team were heading for victory leading 2-1 until an 89th minute equaliser.
Al-Ahli won the penalty shootout 5-3.
Ronaldo has now scored one hundred goals for four different clubs -
Real Madrid, Manchester United, Juventus
and now
Al Nassr.

live_updates.title: De Bruyne scores on Napoli debut
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Kevin de Bruyne
scored his first
Napoli
goal as Antonio Conte's side started their Scudetto defence with a 2-0 win at
Sassuolo.
On his Serie A debut, the Belgium midfielder had put Napoli 2-0 up after
Scott McTominay
had given them a half-time lead.
Sassuolo's cause became even harder with 11 minutes to go as Ismael Kone was shown a red card, with Napoli then cruising to victory.

live_updates.title: Rashford subbed at half-time before Barca mount comeback
live_updates.author: Patrick Rowe
live_updates.text:
Marcus Rashford
was substituted at half-time before
Barcelona
left it late to beat
Levante
3-2.
The La Liga champions went two-nil down in the first half thanks to goals from
Ivan Romero
and
Jose Morales
but battled back after the restart.
Hansi Flick substituted Rashford and
Marc Casado
for
Gavi
and
Dani Olmo
at the break, with
Pedri
then pulling a goal back for Barca within three minutes of the changes with a stunner from long-range.
Ferran Torres
netted the equaliser shortly after (52) and an
Unai Elgezabal Udondo
own-goal in the 91st minute then secured all three points, lifting the visitors to the top of the table.

live_updates.title: Rowe joins Bologna after Marseille bust-up with Rabiot
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
England U21 international
Jonathan Rowe
has joined
Bologna
in a permanent move from
Marseille
after he was transfer-listed by the French club following a bust-up with
Adrien Rabiot
.
Rowe and Rabiot clashed in a heated argument after the opening Ligue 1 loss at Rennes, which was widely reported in France to have become physical.
The ex-Norwich forward has now found a new club after sealing a £16.9m (€19.5m) move to Serie A side Bologna, with Marseille having a 10 per cent sell-on clause in the deal.

live_updates.title: FA investigating Palace banner vs Forest
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
The Football Association
will investigate a graphic banner displayed by
Crystal Palace
fans about
Nottingham Forest
owner
Evangelos Marinakis
during Sunday's 1-1 draw between the clubs.
The game at Selhurst Park was their first meeting since FA Cup winners Palace were relegated to the Europa Conference League due to UEFA's multi-club ownership rules, with Forest instead handed a place in the Europa League.
The FA is looking into the matter to determine if any sanctions should follow.
Palace have been contacted for comment. Forest declined to comment.

live_updates.title: Ramsey not selected as Ampadu ruled out of Wales squad
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Latest from Geraint Hughes, Sports News Correspondent:
Despite making his debut in Mexico for Pumas UNAM on Monday, former Arsenal and Juventus midfielder
Aaron Ramsey
has not been selected by
Wales
manager
Craig Bellamy
for their crucial World Cup qualifier against
Kazakhstan
next week.
Ramsey, beset by injury setbacks, made a bold choice to leave his boyhood club Cardiff City to pursue his playing career and chances of representing Wales at the FIFA World Cup next year, due to be hosted jointly by the USA, Canada and Mexico.
Until coming on as a second half substitute for Pumas in a 0-0 draw against Puebla, Ramsey had not played any football since March when he picked up a hamstring injury playing for Cardiff against Luton.
He hasn't featured in a Wales squad since last September due to injuries. Ramsey's absence may only be temporary. Given his lack of football over the past 12 months and only now making his Pumas debut it was unlikely that Ramsey would be able to start and, given in the September international window Wales only have one competitive match, why make Ramsey travel from Mexico to Kazakhstan via Cardiff for a game he could at best have a limited impact on?
The large distances to travel and time on a plane would only add the risk of fatigue. For Wales it might be better for him to remain in Mexico to train and play with important qualifying fixtures coming up against Belgium in October, and Liechtenstein and North Macedonia in November.
It's highly unlikely Ramsey's Wales career is over. Bellamy is not a coach who will close the door on any player. He is pragmatic when it comes to Wales selection, leaning on experienced players like Ramsey, but also promoting young players into the senior squad.
For this camp Bellamy has included three uncapped players in
Kai Andrews
,
Ronan Kpakio
and
Dylan Lawlor
, but the absence of Leeds captain
Ethan Ampadu
through injury will be a blow. for Bellamy.
The 24 year old picked up a knee injury during Leeds 1-0 win over Everton earlier this month.
Wales play Kazakhstan on September 4 in a Group J World Cup Qualifier, followed by a friendly against Canada in Swansea on September 9.

live_updates.title: Besiktas sack Solskjaer
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Besiktas
have announced that
Ole Gunnar Solskjaer
has been sacked as their head coach.
The Turkish side were knocked out of the Europa Conference League by Swiss side Lausanne tonight.
The decision regarding the former Manchester United head coach comes following a Besiktas board meeting.

live_updates.title: Injured Cunha replaced in Brazil squad
live_updates.author: Richard Damerell
live_updates.text:
Manchester United forward Matheus Cunha has been replaced in the Brazil squad after he sustained a hamstring injury in Saturday's Premier League win over Burnley.
Brazil coach Carlo Ancelotti has already brought in a replacement for Cunha as he called up Flamengo striker Samuel Lino for games against Chile and Bolivia, in the last two rounds of the 2026 World Cup Qualifiers.
Cunha limped off in the first half of United's 3-2 win at Old Trafford and head coach Ruben Amorim expressed concerns about the Brazil international and Mason Mount, who was also withdrawn with an injury.
“It was hard to lose Cunha and Mason Mount, because Mason Mount played 30 minutes with an injury,” said Amorim.
“I’m concerned about that, because they are so important for us. We will see.”
“I don’t know [how they are], I don’t know. We will check them," he added, in his press conference.
"We need those guys really bad to be really competitive.”

live_updates.title: Arteta eyeing 'convincing' win at Anfield
live_updates.author: Nick Wright
live_updates.text:
Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta on facing Liverpool:
"Very important game. You want to continue building the momentum we are in right now. Going to those grounds, against this kind of opposition, is what you want. Coming from those big games winning in a really convincing way, that's the objective."
On what's needed to end winless run at Anfield since 2012:
"Be better, be more efficient, and do what we have done with many other stats we had, even for longer. Just go there and be convinced we can go to Anfield and win."

live_updates.title: Arteta on Arsenal's injury problems
live_updates.author: Nick Wright
live_updates.text:
Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta on addressing Arsenal's injury issues:
"We have to analyse what we do, that's for sure. In the previous season, we had the best [injury] record in the Premier League. The following season, we had one of the worst, as well because of the extent of the injuries of certain players - Tomiyasu, Gabriel Jesus, the long-term injuries we had with the hamstring injuries.
"We have looked at everything. We are continually monitoring and evolving the needs of the players and the schedule. Unfortunately we picked up very diverse injuries again, some of them very unexpected."

live_updates.title: Arteta: Martinelli still super-important
live_updates.author: Nick Wright
live_updates.text:
Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta on whether Gabriel Martinelli could leave:
"No. I think Gabby has been a super-important player for us and he is going to remain very important.
"The fact we have options, with different qualities, that's going to fulfil what we want, because every opponent requires different things.
"We have that competition in many other areas of the pitch and it's needed in the front line, to start the game, and to finish the game.
"I'm very happy with what we have."

live_updates.title: Arteta: Arsenal aiming to take Liverpool's crown
live_updates.author: Nick Wright
live_updates.text:
Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta:
"The favourite is always the one that won in the previous year. Someone has to come and take that crown away from them, and that's what we, the rest, are going to try to do.
"We have already started with the first two games in the Premier League, and that's the aim, be better than them."

live_updates.title: Arteta: Saka hamstring injuries a big concern
live_updates.author: Nick Wright
live_updates.text:
Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta asked whether he is concerned by Bukayo Saka's hamstring injuries:
"Yes it is a big [concern], especially when we talk about a sprinter, a player who gets into that zone very often, who needs that burst, that change of pace to be as threatening as possible.
"We will learn again why it happened and make him stronger, but unfortunately injuries are part of your career. He hasn't had that many, with the amount of games he has played, but it's something we want to eradicate."

live_updates.title: How does the injury table look?
live_updates.author: Adam Smith
live_updates.text:
Crystal Palace
,
Spurs
and
Sunderland
all have seven players sidelined with injuries or suspensions heading into matchday three.
You can use the interactive table below to see the full list of players...

live_updates.title: Emery: We are very busy
live_updates.author: Adam Bate
live_updates.text:
Sky Sports' Adam Bate at Aston Villa's training ground:
Unai Emery
acknowledged that
Aston Villa
’s start to the season has been “poor” and does not expect it to get easier against a Crystal Palace side that has proven a tricky match-up for his side under Oliver Glasner.
The Villa boss is hoping to get some help in the next few days before the transfer window closes, however. “We are very busy. We are working here, we are active,” he said.
Asked by
Sky Sports
about the possibility of
Marco Asensio
returning, he added: “I don't want to speak about some players because we have different options. Of course, you are asking me about Marco Asensio, I was so happy with him [last season] in general.”

live_updates.title: Palace to discover Conference League opponents on Friday
live_updates.author: David Richardson
live_updates.text:
Crystal Palace
will now enter the league phase of the Conference League, a 36-team division where every club is ranked together in a single table.
The
Eagles drew 0-0 away to Fredrikstad
on Thursday, winning their play-off tie 1-0 on aggregate.
The draw will be made
on Friday at 12pm
and feature the 24 winners of the play-off-round ties and the 12 losers from the Europa League play-offs.
After six matches, the top eight teams advance directly to the round of 16, teams ranked 9th-24th compete in a knockout play-off round for a spot in the round of 16, and teams ranked 25th-36th are eliminated from the competition.

live_updates.title: Palace scouting targets as Guehi enters final year of deal
live_updates.author: Charlotte Marsh
live_updates.text:
Crystal Palace
are preparing for life without
Marc Guehi
by scouring the transfer market for replacements for their captain, according to
the Mirror.
The defender has one year left on his deal, and is at risk of leave for free next summer.
The Eagles have been linked with Man City's
Manuel Akanji
earlier this week and a loan move for Monaco's
Mohammed Salisu.
Rennes defender
Jeremy Jacquet
and Toulouse’s
Jaydee Canvot
are also names in the mix.

live_updates.title: Glasner confident of more signings this window
live_updates.author: Charlotte Marsh
live_updates.text:
Crystal Palace
manager
Oliver Glasner
is confident the club will bring in new players before Monday's deadline.
However, he expressed disappointment that the club could not make more signings before the season started, allowing the players more time to integrate into the squad.
He said: "Frustration is maybe the wrong word. We had a meeting in March and we were talking about the strategy for the summer.
"We knew that Eberechi could leave the club so at the beginning, it was not in our hands but we knew we had to be prepared.
"We knew the situation about Marc and we had to be prepared.
"We wanted to bring the players in at the beginning of pre-season, to be in a good position of negotiating and to integrate the players.
"Now having to integrate four or five players delays being successful. This is the missed opportunities to bring in the players early enough.
"Usually when you are busy at the end, you missed something at the beginning. Everywhere is the same.
"We know we have to sign a few players. It's a responsibility of Crystal Palace to be competitive in the Premier League, the Conference League and the cup competitions again.
"I'm still confident we'll get the right players in."

live_updates.title: Crystal Palace complete Pino signing
live_updates.author: Charlotte Marsh
live_updates.text:
Crystal Palace
have completed the signing of
Yeremy Pino
from
Villarreal.
The 22-year-old has signed a five-year deal in south London for a fee of £21m plus £5m in add-ons.
Pino had 45 goal contributions in 175 appearances for Villarreal, as well as three goals in 15 caps for Spain.
Chairman Steve Parish told the
club's media
: “It’s fantastic news that Yeremy – an exciting young talent, with already such an impressive record in domestic, European and international football – has chosen us as the next step in his career.
“With an exciting season ahead for the club, competing on multiple fronts, he is a player whose talents Palace fans will particularly appreciate – and I look forward to seeing him step out at Selhurst Park.”

live_updates.title: Palace interested in Bundesliga midfielder and Ligue 1 defender
live_updates.author: Patrick Rowe
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' James Savundra:
Crystal Palace
are interested in signing
Christoph Baumgartner
from
RB Leipzig
.
The attacking midfielder is one of
Oliver Glasner’s
top targets in this window.
However,
Xavi Simons'
imminent departure to Tottenham means that the Bundesliga club do not want to sell him this summer.
Palace are also attempting to sign centre-back
Jaydee Canvot
from
Toulouse
.
The two clubs are close to a £22.5m (€26m) agreement and it is now up to the 19-year-old to decide.
It is understood that Canvot has already turned down a number of Premier League clubs already this summer.
Palace’s pursuit of Canvot is not linked to a potential departure for
Marc Guehi
.
The Eagles will line up a readymade replacement for Guehi if his exit is sanctioned prior to Monday’s deadline.

live_updates.title: Roma make offer for Chelsea's George as Palace eye move
live_updates.author: joeshread
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Dharmesh Sheth and Adrian Kajumba:
Roma
have made an offer to sign
Chelsea
forward
Tyrique George
.
Sky Sports News
understands
Fulham
and
Crystal Palace
are the top-flight clubs keeping an eye on his situation.
Bayern Munich
have also shown an interest, but they have explored a loan.
Chelsea's preference is to do a permanent deal.

live_updates.title: Guehi's future remains up in the air
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' chief correspondent Kaveh Solhekol:
Marc Guehi’s
future is up in the air with 72 hours to go until the window closes.
There has been no movement so far today regarding any potential bids for the
Crystal Palace
captain.
Eagles boss
Oliver Glasner
said Guehi has to stay and would be impossible to replace.
Palace chairman
Steve Parish
has said they cannot let him leave as a free agent next summer.
Liverpool
were in talks about signing the defender earlier this month.
Palace and Liverpool are both preparing for games on Sunday.

live_updates.title: Bournemouth reject Palace's bid for Brooks
live_updates.author: Dominic Ball
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Kaveh Solhekol, Mark McAdam and James Savundra:
Bournemouth
have rejected a £4m bid from
Crystal Palace
for midfielder
David Brooks
.
The deal had add-ons that could have got to £8m.
Bournemouth’s stance is clear: the player is not for sale.
The 28-year-old has just one year left on his current Bournemouth deal.

live_updates.title: Guehi 'has to' stay at Palace beyond deadline, says Glasner
live_updates.author: Charlotte Marsh
live_updates.text:
Crystal Palace
manager
Oliver Glasner
says as far as he is concerned
Marc Guehi
has to stay in the final days of the window.
The Eagles defender is into the final year of his current deal and had been linked with a move away this summer, but that has not materialised.
Glasner says there is now no time to find a ready-made replacement for the club captain, adding that Guehi remains committed to the Eagles.
Glasner said: "From my side, he has to [still be a Crystal Palace player] because it's not possible at the moment to find a Marc Guehi replacement who can play straight in the Premier League, being a starter, being consistent.
"When we see our foundation of success in the last few months, it's our defence... Marc is a crucial part.
"Getting the right replacement in now is almost impossible.
"He shows in every game that he's focused. If Marc had said 'I want to leave Crystal Palace', it would already have happened weeks ago.
"Marc is fully committed to the team, he shows it every third day at the moment... it is my point of view that we need to keep Marc."

live_updates.title: Liverpool make £35m bid for Guehi
live_updates.author: Zinny Boswell
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Mark McAdam, Kaveh Solhekol, Lyall Thomas and Rob Dorsett:
Liverpool
have made a £35m offer for
Crystal Palace
defender
Marc Guehi
.
The bid is currently being considered by Palace.
However, the South London club do not want to sell the defender until they have a replacement.
Sky Sports News
understands Liverpool's
Joe Gomez
has become a part of discussions between the clubs.
Palace have an interest in Gomez - and it would be a separate deal - but how keen he is on the move to Selhurst Park at this stage is unknown.
Liverpool would not allow Gomez to leave on loan and they are also reluctant to sell a player who offers so much versatility in their backline.
Gomez is also on the lists at
AC Milan
and
Tottenham
, although
Thomas Frank
has appeared to cool his interest in signing a new centre-back.
Milan appear to be prioritising
Manchester City's Manuel Akanji
at the moment - another player of interest to Palace and on Spurs' radar.
Guehi's future could go right to the wire with Deadline Day approaching on September 1.
Palace boss Oliver Glasner has pleaded for the player to stay at the club until his contract expires next summer.
Palace could sign more than one new centre-back. Separately from the Guehi situation, they are progressing with a £22.5m deal for
Toulouse's
19-year-old
Jaydee Canvot
.

live_updates.title: Leicester want to sign Palace winger Rak-Sakyi on loan
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Rob Dorsett:
Leicester
want to sign
Jesurun Rak-Sakyi
on loan from
Crystal Palace
before the deadline.
Palace are reluctant to let the winger go without a replacement.
The 22-year-old has two years left on his contract at Palace.

live_updates.title: VAR Review show to be shown on Sky Sports
live_updates.author: Sahil Jaidka
live_updates.text:
The
Scottish FA VAR Review show
will be shown on
Sky Sports Football
this season.
It will be hosted by
Gordon Duncan
as the SFA's head of refereeing
Willie Collum
looks back at the key incidents from across Scottish football.
The first episode will air on Sky Sports Football on
Friday September 12 at 6pm
and continue every month throughout the 2025/26 season.

live_updates.title: Raskin trains away from Rangers first team
live_updates.author: Sahil Jaidka
live_updates.text:
Sky Sports News
understands
Nicolas Raskin
trained away from the
Rangers
first team on Friday as the group prepared for Sunday’s Old Firm match.
Speaking at his pre-match news conference, head coach
Russell Martin
refused to confirm if the player would be in the squad for the clash at Ibrox –
live on Sky Sports
.
“Everyone’s here and available," he said.
"The squad and team will be picked on what we think will be the best way to win the game.
“Nico was training today. The whole squad is here but things can change because the transfer window is open. So I can’t say if anyone will definitely be in the squad or not.
“I’d describe my relationship with all the players as honest and open.
“I don’t think you can have anything apart from that. There is no breakdown in any relationships here – if it is honest and open, there can’t be a breakdown in any relationship.”
Sky Sports News
understands Raskin has been on
Wolves’
radar, but the club currently do not have space available for a non-homegrown player.

live_updates.title: Swansea waiting on Celtic green-light for Idah's move
live_updates.author: Sahil Jaidka
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Anthony Joseph:
Swansea City
are waiting on
Celtic
to green-light
Adam Idah’s
£7m move to the club.
It is understood that the striker completed a medical and has agreed personal terms with the Welsh side.
But he was called back up by Celtic after boss
Brendan Rodgers
demanded that the club find a replacement first.
Celtic are advancing in talks for
Anderlecht
striker
Kasper Dolberg
and are hoping to get a deal done in time for the Denmark international to be registered to face Rangers on Sunday, live on
Sky Sports
.
As things stand, there is no full agreement. But, if that deal can be agreed, Idah is expected to finally seal his move to Swansea.
Rodgers told
Sky Sports News
on Friday: "There is interest in Adam, but like l've said to the club, we can't let anyone go - especially on the front line - unless we have replacements.”

live_updates.title: Misovski completes Rangers medical ahead of £4.2m move from Girona
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Anthony Joseph and Sahil Jaidka:
Girona
striker
Bojan Miovski
has completed a medical in France ahead of his £4.2m move to
Rangers
.
It is understood that the North Macedonia international is due to travel to Glasgow on Saturday to finalise his transfer.
Rangers are set to confirm the signing of Miovski in the next 24 hours and if registered in time, he could make his debut against
Celtic
on Sunday –
live on Sky Sports
.

live_updates.title: Rangers sign Miovski from Girona
live_updates.author: Sahil Jaidka
live_updates.text:
Rangers
have signed striker
Bojan
Miovski
from
Girona
in a deal worth up to £4.2m.
The Ibrox club will pay an initial fee of around £2.6m for the 26-year-old, with a further £1.6m in performance-based add-ons.
Miovski has signed a deal until 2029 at Ibrox as he returns to Scotland one year after his £6.8m move from Aberdeen to LaLiga.
He scored 44 goals in 98 games for the Dons, but struggled in Spain, netting just four times in 23 appearances.
Sky Sports News
understands Miovski could make his Rangers debut at Ibrox on Sunday as his new side face
Celtic
in the first Old Firm clash of the season,
live on Sky Sports
.

live_updates.title: Frame seals Aberdeen move from Celtic
live_updates.author: Richard Damerell
live_updates.text:
Mitchel Frame
has joined
Aberdeen
from
Celtic
on a four-year deal.
The 19-year-old left-back has represented Scotland at Under-17 and Under-19 level.
Frame rose through the ranks at the Celtic academy, making his senior debut for the club in a Champions League victory over Feyenoord in 2023.
“We have been monitoring Mitchel’s progress for some time, and we are very pleased we have eventually managed to sign him”, said Dons boss
Jimmy Thelin
.
“He is a forward-thinking full back, with pace and physicality, and he fits well with how we want to play and what our expectations are of our full backs. His arrival will also give us more resilience and stability in that area of the pitch.
“He’s an exciting talent and we look forward to working with him to help him release his future potential.”

live_updates.title: Sheehan: Ask Celtic about Idah
live_updates.author: Callum Bishop
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports' Anthony Joseph:
Swansea City
boss
Alan Sheehan
told reporters to “ask Celtic” what is going on with
Adam Idah’s
situation.
Idah   completed a medical and agreed personal terms ahead of a £7m move, but   was called back by Celtic after they struggled to reach an agreement   with Anderlecht for striker Kasper Dolberg by close of play yesterday.
Talks   are ongoing between Celtic and Anderlecht over Dolberg and there’s   still a feeling Idah could join Swansea before Monday’s transfer   deadline.
Following  their 2-0 win at Sheffield Wednesday today,  Sheehan said: "The latest  is that he is not our player. He is currently  a Glasgow Celtic player so  right now I can only talk about Swansea  players.
"I think if you ask Celtic potentially you'd get the  answer to that question."I  can't speak on behalf of Celtic. I can speak  on behalf of every Swansea  fan that came here, every staff member and  every player."

live_updates.title: Anderlecht hope to sign striker before allowing Dolberg to leave
live_updates.author: Charlotte Marsh
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Anthony Joseph and Sky Italy:
Anderlecht
are hoping to bring in another striker before allowing
Celtic
target
Kasper Dolberg
to leave.
The Hoops have been locked in talks with the Belgian club since yesterday morning.
Negotiations were initially said to be progressing well but no agreement was reached by the end of the day.
Anderlecht were also hit with bad injury news to their striking department yesterday, following their European exit the night before.
Sky Italy
are reporting that Anderlecht have made a bid for
Genoa’s Vitinha
. The Serie A club are considering the offer.
If a deal can be reached it could see Anderlecht more open to reaching an agreement with Celtic for Dolberg and pave the way for
Adam Idah’s
£7m move to
Swansea City.

live_updates.title: Villa in talks for Dons' Boyd
live_updates.author: Charlotte Marsh
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Anthony Joseph and Lyall Thomas:
Aston Villa
are in talks to sign
Aberdeen
attacker midfielder
Fletcher Boyd.
It’s understood the Dons are looking for a fee in the region of £1m, plus add-ons - including a significant sell-on clause.
Villa have been tracking the 17-year-old for some time and made initial contact in June.
Sky Sports News
has been told that all parties are hopeful of reaching a deal before Monday’s transfer deadline.

live_updates.title: Rangers keen on Cornelius
live_updates.author: Sahil Jaidka
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports' Sahil Jaidka and Sky Italy:
Rangers
are keen to sign
Marseille
defender
Derek
Cornelius
before the deadline.
However, they face competition from
Cremonese,
with
Sky in Italy
reporting that they are also in talks over a deal for the 27-year-old.
Ibrox boss
Russell Martin
is keen to bolster his defensive options ahead of Monday’s deadline.
Cornelius is a left-footed centre-back who can also play as a left-back, with Rangers light of options in that area.
He made 23 appearances for Marseille last season across all competitions and has three years left on his contract with the French club.
Cornelius is a
Canada
international with 35 caps for his country.

live_updates.title: Celtic striker Idah in Wales as he closes in on £7m move to Swansea
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Anthony Joseph:
Celtic
striker
Adam Idah
is in Wales under going the second part of his medical ahead of a £7m move to
Swansea City
.
The Republic of Ireland international travelled last night and was not in Celtic’s squad for their 0-0 draw with Rangers at Ibrox.
Idah is expected to finalise his move, with Celtic making continued progress in talks for
Anderlecht
forward
Kasper Dolberg
.
Sky Sports News
understands Celtic and Swansea have agreed an initial fee of £6m, plus more than £1m in add-ons.
Idah completed the first part of his medical with Swansea on Friday and agreed personal terms.
He was then called back by Celtic after the Hoops struggled to reach an agreement for Dolberg by close of play that day.
Celtic are looking to sign two strikers before tomorrow’s 11pm deadline in Scotland.

live_updates.title: Hurzeler '100 per cent sure' Baleba stays at Brighton
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Fabian Hurzeler
has said he is 100 per cent confident
Carlos Baleba
will remain a
Brighton
player beyond the transfer window shutting on September 1.
The midfielder has been the subject of interest from Man Utd this summer, but the Seagulls have remained firm in their stance that Baleba is not for sale.
"If there was a number higher than 100 I would give you that," Hurzeler said in his pre-Man City press conference on Thursday.
He also added that his gut instinct is there won't be any more incomings at Brighton, and reiterated his happiness with the shape of the squad.

live_updates.title: Enciso back at Brighton after injury derails move
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Fabian Hurzeler
says
Julio Enciso
has returned to
Brighton
to continue his rehabilitation amid reports his move to Strasbourg could be off.
Enciso was expected to join the French club for around £20m, with a deal close to being finalised this time last week.
However, the attacking midfielder, who does not feature in Hurzeler's plans, is now back at Brighton with less than five days of the window to go.
Asked to clear up Enciso's situation, Hurzeler said: "It is not a big injury, so he is back in rehab training.
"It is very important that the players now are our plans for the future.
"We have an open conversation with Julio and then we will see what happens in the next days."

live_updates.title: Brighton open to offers for Sarmiento
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Cremonese
are also in talks over the signing of
Brighton
winger
Jeremy Sarmiento
, according to
Sky in Italy
.
Brighton are open to letting him go before the window closes.
Sarmiento has spent the last three seasons on loan at different clubs in the Championship.
The 23-year-old played for Burnley in the previous campaign as they gained automatic promotion to the Premier League.
He has two years left on his current deal at Brighton.

live_updates.title: Leeds advancing in Buonanotte pursuit
live_updates.author: Charlotte Marsh
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Elliot Cook:
Leeds United
have advanced in their pursuit of
Brighton
attacking midfielder
Facundo Buonanotte.
Brighton have been keen for the 20-year-old to go on loan to an English club to gain more experience after his spell at Leicester last season.
Bounanotte fits the profile of player Leeds have been looking for as they try to bolster their creative options in the final third.
The Argentina international, who has been attracting interest from Champions League clubs, can play as a No 10 and on the right wing.
Buonanotte's departure from Brighton would be a straight loan with no obligation involved in the deal.
Sky Germany
reported earlier in the window that Dortmund had made a loan offer for the player.

live_updates.title: Abdallah Sima joins Lens
live_updates.author: Dominic Ball
live_updates.text:
Brighton
striker
Abdallah Sima
has joined Ligue 1 club
Lens
in a deal worth £4m plus add-ons.
The forward, who never made a Premier League appearance for the Premier League side after joining in 2021, has had loan spells at Stoke, Angers, Rangers and Stade Brestois.
Brighton are working on trimming their squad ahead of Monday's deadline.
Facundo Buonanotte
could depart to Chelsea with talks ongoing between the west London club and Brighton.
Jeremy Sarmiento
may also leave while Tariq Lamptey is attracting interest.

live_updates.title: Brighton's Enciso edging closer to Strasbourg move
live_updates.author: Dominic Ball
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Elliot Cook:
Chelsea's
owners BlueCo are edging closer to completing a deal with
Brighton
for
Julio Enciso
to join
Strasbourg
.
The 21-year-old is being offered a five-year contract.
It is expected the transfer will be completed before the window closes on Monday.
Sky Sports News
reported on Thursday that Enciso had returned to Brighton to continue his rehab on a knee injury.
The Paraguay international will initially move to BlueCo-owned Strasbourg.
Enciso is not part of Fabian Hurzeler's plans this season and spent the second half of last season on loan at Ipswich.

live_updates.title: Chelsea close to completing loan signing of Brighton's Buonanotte
live_updates.author: Dominic Ball
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Elliot Cook and Mark McAdam:
Chelsea
are close to completing the loan signing of
Brighton
attacking midfielder
Facundo Buonanotte
.
The deal under discussion does not include an option or an obligation to buy - it is a season-long loan.
There was interest in the 20-year-old from other Premier League clubs, including
Leeds United
.
Brighton only wanted to loan the Argentina international to a club in England.
Borussia Dortmund
had made a loan offer for the player with an option, while there was also interest from French outfit
Lyon
.

live_updates.title: Cremonese reach agreement for Sarmiento
live_updates.author: David Richardson
live_updates.text:
Cremonese
have reached an agreement with
Brighton
for the signing of winger
Jeremy Sarmiento
, according to
Sky in Italy.
The deal is for a loan with an option to buy, which could become an obligation if the Italian club avoid relegation from Serie A.
Sarmiento has two years left on his current deal at Brighton.

live_updates.title: Fiorentina agree Lamptey deal
live_updates.author: Charlotte Marsh
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News'  Mark McAdam and Elliot Cook:
Fiorentina
have agreed a deal with
Brighton
for the signing of
Tariq Lamptey.
The transfer is worth up to £6m including add-ons.
Lamptey still needs to take a medical and finalise terms with the Italian club before the move goes through.

live_updates.title: Wolves bid for £20m-rated Genk striker Arokodare
live_updates.author: Richard Morgan
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News reporters Dharmesh Sheth & Adam Bate:
Wolves
have made an official offer for
KRC Genk
striker
Tolu Arokodare
.
Genk value the player, was top scorer in Belgian League last season with 17 goals, at around £20m.

live_updates.title: Wolves' Fabio Silva completing Dortmund medical
live_updates.author: Peter Smith
live_updates.text:
Wolves' Fabio Silva
is now undergoing the second part of his medical with
Borussia Dortmund
.
He must be registered by 3pm today if he is to be included in the squad on Sunday against Union Berlin.
The player flew into Germany yesterday after the clubs agreed a £22.8m deal.

live_updates.title: Wolves also interested in Hackney
live_updates.author: Charlotte Marsh
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Lyall Thomas, Anthony Joseph and Sahil Jaidka:
Wolves
are also among the clubs who hold an interest in
Middlesbrough
midfielder
Hayden Hackney.
It is understood no approach has been made and the club realise it could be a difficult deal to do at this stage.
Middlesbrough have made it clear Hackney is not for sale in the final few days of the window.
West Ham, Fulham
and
Everton
have all shown interest in Hackney this summer – but there have been no formal offers yet from them either.
Boro feel it is too late in the window to sign an adequate replacement, and they have made a strong start to the campaign.
Sky Sports News
understands Hackney has made it clear to the club that if a Premier League club comes in, it is his dream to play in the top flight.
Boro were believed to be open to selling Hackney earlier in the window, but no Premier League offers materialised.
Hackney turned down a potential move to Championship rivals Ipswich earlier in the window.
Rangers’ Nico Raskin
has also been on Wolves’ radar but the club currently don’t have space available for a non-homegrown player.

live_updates.title: Pereira refuses to rule out Strand Larsen move
live_updates.author: Ron Walker
live_updates.text:
Wolves
head coach
Vitor Pereira
has refused to confirm
Jorgen Strand Larsen
will remain at the club beyond the transfer deadline – but hopes he can feature in Saturday’s game with
Everton
.
The 25-year-old has been subject of multiple bids from Newcastle in recent weeks, but the Magpies now appear to have turned their attentions to Stuttgart forward Nick Woltemade, who is close to signing at St James’ Park.
Pereira said of his forward: “It’s important that we know that every person has ambitions in life.
But in this moment, Jorgen is our player. He's working hard because he has a good personality. He's a team player.
“In this moment, he's dealing with small injury problems. I hope we can play tomorrow with him because maybe it's a small problem. But at the end of the day, he's our player, an important player for us.
“Everything that we cannot control is out of our control. We cannot lose energy with that. I understand football, I understand everything.
“But in this moment, it's a moment to think about the team, how to win the game because it's a very important game for us.
On whether Strand Larsen could down tools, after both Alexander Isak and Yoane Wissa were exiled from training at their respective clubs, Pereira said: “This is not the Jorgan I know. The Jorgen I know has a good personality and is a very good player.
“I know that, of course, this is a situation that everybody is talking about the same subject. I believe that the player can think about it.
“But at the end of the day, he cannot control the situation. At the end of the day, he must focus on the team, trying to focus on the team, to do his best to help the club.”
When asked whether he was 100-per-cent certain Strand Larsen would stay, he added: “He's our player.”

live_updates.title: Wolves agree deal for Genk striker
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Lyall Thomas:
Wolves
have agreed a £23.4m (€27m) deal with
Genk
for striker
Tolu Arokodare
.
They will pay an initial £22.5m (€26m) plus £900k (€1m) in add-ons.
Sky Sports News
has been told this deal does not have any implications on
Jorgen Strand Larsen's
future at the club amid interest from
Newcastle
.
Wolves maintain that he is not for sale.

live_updates.title: Pereira wants two more signings
live_updates.author: Adam Bate
live_updates.text:
Wolves supporters were left frustrated as their team succumbed to a third consecutive Premier League defeat as they were
beaten 3-2 by Everton
. During the second half, they made their feelings clear. “Back the team or sell the club,” they sang to the owners.
Asked in the press conference about those chants and whether he feels backed, Vitor Pereira said: “They are trying to help the team. I hope until the end of the market they try to add at least two players to help us because we need more solutions. Especially in attack.”
Pereira added that he also wants “solution in midfield because we need competition” and stressed that he empathised with the supporters. “I am suffering with them because, more than the result, I don’t see my team playing the way we are working.”
The Wolves boss did suggest that striker Jorgen Strand Larsen would still be at the club at the conclusion of the transfer window, reiterating that the reason for his omission for his game was the result of an inflamed Achilles tendon suffered against Bournemouth.

live_updates.title: Wolves aim to bring in Brownhill
live_updates.author: Richard Damerell
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Lyall Thomas and James Savundra:
Wolves
are in talks to sign free agent
Josh Brownhill
after he left
Burnley
.
The midfielder is currently considering a huge offer from
Al Shabab
, who are willing to pay the 29-year-old more than £100,000 per week.
However, Wolves have held discussions with Brownhill’s representatives in regards to a potential deal.
Wolves have held a long-term interest in the former Burnley player who scored 18 goals in the Clarets' successful promotion campaign last season.
Brownhill rejected a fresh contract offer from Burnley this summer.
If Wolves were to beat the Saudi Pro League club to the signature of Brownhill, then the midfielder would link up with Vitor Pereira, who managed Al Shabab until last December.

live_updates.title: Striker Arokodare flying in for Wolves medical
live_updates.author: Richard Damerell
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Lyall Thomas:
Striker
Tolu Arokodare
is flying in for a medical with
Wolves
today ahead of his £23.4m (€27m) deal from
Genk
.
Personal terms have also been agreed with the 24-year-old.
Wolves will pay an initial £22.5m (€26m) plus £900k (€1m) in add-ons for the Nigeria international.
Sky Sports News
has been told this deal does not have any implications on
Newcastle
target
Jorgen Strand Larsen's
future at the club.
Wolves maintain that he is not for sale.

live_updates.title: Saturday's STUNNING free-kicks!
live_updates.author: Dan Long
live_updates.text:
Here's one from Watford's
Nestory Irankunda
...
Here's one from Oxford's
Cameron Brannagan...
And here's one from Coventry's
Victor Torp
!

live_updates.title: West Brom set for Gilchrist signing
live_updates.author: Charlotte Marsh
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Kaveh Solhekol and Lyall Thomas:
West Brom
are set to sign
Chelsea’s Alfie Gilchrist
in an initial £1.2m deal.
Gilchrist is having a medical with Albion today. There are some bonuses agreed in the deal also.
The 21-year-old spent last season on loan at Sheffield United, making 32 appearances.

live_updates.title: Lions complete Taylor signing from West Brom
live_updates.author: Peter Smith
live_updates.text:
Millwall
have completed the signing of centre-back
Caleb Taylor
from
West Brom
.
The Lions are signing Taylor after defender Japhet Tanganga was sold to Sheffield United.

live_updates.title: Andrews close to Watford exit
live_updates.author: Patrick Rowe
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Anthony Joseph and Sky in Italy's Luca Bendoni:
Young Boys
are close to agreeing a deal for
Watford
right-back
Ryan Andrews
.
It’s understood a fee of £2.6m, plus add-ons, are being discussed.
Andrews is looking to move for more regular first-team football.
