live_updates.title: Essential EFL podcast: Championship predictions
live_updates.author: Simeon Gholam
live_updates.text:
Sky Sports duo Simeon Gholam and David Prutton take a look ahead at Gameweek FOUR of the Sky Bet Championship season.
👉
Give the Sky Sports Essential EFL podcast a follow

live_updates.title: Ipswich sign attacker Egeli in Championship record deal
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Ipswich
have signed teenage forward
Sindre Walle Egeli
from Danish club
FC Nordsjaelland
for a Championship record fee.
The deal is worth £17.5m, eclipsing the £15.4m
Burnley
paid Genk for
Mike Tresor
last summer.
The 19-year-old has signed a five-year contract at Portman Road.
He scored 11 goals in 40 appearances for FC Nordsjaelland and has already made his international debut for Norway.
“I’m really excited to have signed for this club,” he said.
“This is a club with great history and great plans for the future and this is something I really want to be a part of.
“As soon as I knew Ipswich were interested, I was excited to come and I believe this club is the perfect place for me to progress in my career.
“I have had some great conversations with the manager and now I can’t wait to get started, meet my team-mates and also the supporters.”

live_updates.title: Wrexham in talks for Vyner
live_updates.author: Charlotte Marsh
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Lyall Thomas and Anthony Joseph:
Wrexham
are in talks to sign
Bristol City’s Zak Vyner.
They have had a £1.75m bid rejected so far.

live_updates.title: Young Boys agree deal for Watford's Andrews
live_updates.author: William Bitibiri
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Anthony Joseph and Luca Bendoni:
Young Boys
have agreed a £2.6m deal for
Watford
right-back
Ryan Andrews
.
It’s understood that Watford have inserted a 50 per cent sell-on clause into the deal.
Andrews is due to fly to Switzerland to undergo a medical and finalise the move.

live_updates.title: Watford close in on Mendy
live_updates.author: William Bitibiri
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Anthony Joseph and Luca Bendoni:
Watford
are closing in on the signing of
Lorient
centre-back
Formose Mendy
.
It’s understood that the clubs have agreed a loan deal with an option to buy.
Mendy watched Watford’s 2-2 draw with Southampton at Vicarage Road on Saturday.
He is due to undergo a medical and finalise the paperwork on his move on Sunday.

live_updates.title: Vardy agrees to join Cremonese after rejecting late Feyenoord interest
live_updates.author: Richard Damerell
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Rob Dorsett:
Jamie Vardy
has agreed verbally to join Italian side
Cremonese
, turning down the chance to go to
Feyenoord
.
The Dutch club came in with a late offer, which left him with a difficult decision to make, after their boss
Robin Van Persie
phoned Vardy directly last night to try to persuade him to move to the Netherlands.
The ultimate decision came down to whether Vardy wanted to play in the Champions League and Eredivisie, or Serie A, and in the end, Vardy decided he still wanted to challenge himself in one of the top five European leagues and try to keep the newly-promoted Italian side in the top division.
The 38-year-old has agreed a one-year contract with the option of a further year if Cremonese stay up.
The ex-Leicester striker will travel to Milan for a medical tomorrow and agree on the final details of his contract.

live_updates.title: Selles: Sheffield United future out of my hands
live_updates.author: Charlotte Marsh
live_updates.text:
Ruben Selles
admits his future as
Sheffield United
boss is out of his hands as Blades fans called for the Spaniard to be sacked after just four league games in charge.
Selles’ nightmare start to life in charge of United continued as they went down 1-0 at Middlesbrough on Saturday, leaving the Blades rock bottom and without a point going into the first international break.
Selles said: "I cannot control the situation. I will expect to go to my house tonight and then tomorrow go to work and then continue as normal. It’s not in my hands to make a decision.
"And until the very last moment, I will just do my best and try to do my things. When the situation is not in my control, I don’t think too much about what is going to happen in the future. Because realistically, I do as much as I can.
"At least if I go out, whether that’s tomorrow or if it’s in three years, I will always go out with the feeling that I made the decisions that I want to make. Obviously that includes my mistakes, but my decisions were honest and what I thought was the correct thing to do in every single moment.”
Selles, who previously managed Reading during the Royals’ off-the-field struggles and transfer embargoes, added: “I have been in worse situations and I end up just making the things happen and changing totally around the dynamics.
"So I don’t have a doubt about it. I’ve been in situations where I haven’t been paid on time, situations when they get points deductions, situations where we didn’t know if we would be able to train the next day at the training ground.
"And the reality is that we turned things around at the moment of connection. But you need to work hard to go to that moment and you need to go through a couple of critical moments on that journey."

live_updates.title: Leicester want to sign Palace winger Rak-Sakyi on loan
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Rob Dorsett:
Leicester
want to sign
Jesurun Rak-Sakyi
on loan from
Crystal Palace
before the deadline.
Palace are reluctant to let the winger go without a replacement.
The 22-year-old has two years left on his contract at Palace.

live_updates.title: Frank on midfield options
live_updates.author: Ron Walker
live_updates.text:
Spurs head coach Thomas Frank on the midfield options he has at the club:
"I think we’ve got a very good midfield. I like the six midfielders we have – Archie Gray, Lucas Bergvall, Joao Palhinha, Pape Mata Sarr, Rodrigo Bentancur and Yves Bissouma.
"There’s the creativity of Kulu and JM, but of course they are out so that’s a skillset we need to replace either by signing someone or with Wilson Odobert, Mohammed Kudus or Mathys Tel."

live_updates.title: Frank on Champions League deadline
live_updates.author: Ron Walker
live_updates.text:
Spurs head coach Thomas Frank on the looming Champions League player registration deadline:
"We still have a minor challenge there, and of course a decision will be made in due course."

live_updates.title: Tottenham complete Simons signing
live_updates.author: Ron Walker
live_updates.text: Tottenham have completed the signing of Chelsea target Xavi Simons from RB Leipzig in a deal worth just over £51m.

live_updates.title: Simons: I have been dreaming of this moment
live_updates.author: Patrick Rowe
live_updates.text:
Xavi Simons
has said he has been "dreaming" of joining
Tottenham
for a long time after the club announced his signing on Friday evening.
Spurs completed the signing of Simons from RB Leipzig in a deal worth just over £51m on Friday.
Sky Sports News
understands he has signed a five-year contract that includes an option for a further two years.
Simons is Spurs' seventh signing of the summer and takes their spend to beyond £170m.
"I'm really happy and can't wait to get going. I've been dreaming of this for a long time.
"It's a great club and when I met the head coach I knew straight away that this was the right place for me.
"I will bring flair to the team but also hard work and discipline. I want to do everything I can to win, for the team and also for the fans."

live_updates.title: Frank appears to rule out defender signing
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Tottenham
boss
Thomas Frank
has appeared to rule out signing a centre-back before the deadline.
Spurs have been among the clubs to show some interest in
Manchester City
defender
Manuel Akanji
.
However, AC Milan are now pushing to agree a deal with City for the centre-back.
Asked if Spurs needed another defender, Frank said: "No, as it stands, no.
“We have right now three centre backs: Micky (van Der Ven), (Cristian) Romero, (Kevin) Danso and Ben (Davies) can play there if necessary.
“We have Kota the young central defender we bought this summer and is running now and training with the team next week. There’s not many left behind.
"And then (Radu) Dragusin is coming back in a couple of months so that should be enough.”
Following the £51m arrival of Xavi Simons
,
Sky Sports News
understands signing a left-winger is still a target for Spurs in the final days of the window.

live_updates.title: Who do Tottenham play around their Champions League fixtures?
live_updates.author: David Richardson
live_updates.text:
Premier League games unless stated. All Premier League games subject to date changes due to Champions League schedule.

Sky Sports

, kick-off 8pm

live_updates.title: Tottenham's Champions League fixtures
live_updates.author: David Richardson
live_updates.text:
September 16: Villarreal (H), kick-off 8pm

live_updates.title: REPORT: Brilliant Bournemouth beat shot-shy Spurs to inflict Frank's first PL loss
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Sky Sports' Declan Olley from the Tottenham Hotspur Stadium:
Thomas Frank suffered his first Premier League defeat as Spurs head coach after Bournemouth deservedly won 1-0 at the Tottenham Hotspur Stadium.

live_updates.title: Frank understands boos after Bournemouth loss as he gives 'positive' Solanke update
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Tottenham
boss
Thomas Frank
said he understands the boos from home fans following their 1-0 defeat to
Bournemouth
.
He said at his post-match press conference: “I prefer them not to boo, but I understand it was not a good performance today and they have high expectations, which is absolutely fair.
“Let’s say we performed even better, and we could still lose a football match. Today, I don't think we hit the level we should.”
On his first league loss as Spurs boss, he said: “I think we clearly didn't perform well today.
“We knew exactly what they came with, and we trained for it, but we just didn't handle it well enough in terms of the balls behind and the second ball, and the duels in the middle of the park - that's the defensive side of it.
“On the offensive side, we struggled to find a good enough solution to get through phase one and two, so we could get up there and put a bit of pressure on them.
"We only did that in the last 15, where we put good pressure and we could have equalised, but I think over the game it was fair that Bournemouth won.”
Dominic Solanke
was absent for the loss with a minor ankle injury.
Frank is hopeful he will be back after the international break.
He said of the ankle issue: “It's not like he re-injured it again. You can say that if you have a muscle injury, then you can maybe re-injure it. It's nothing to do with that.
“It's just not progressing as quick as we hoped for. But we are still positive that it can be solved in the next two weeks.”
Asked whether Solanke’s injury would force him to sign another striker in the final days of the transfer window, he replied: “No, but I will not say not particularly.
"I think to have three strikers in the squad can cause a problem. They can only play one at a time.
“So there's a fine balance. I'm not saying we will never go for another striker another time, but I think I'm happy with Dom and Richie.”

live_updates.title: Bournemouth midfielder Traore set to join Marseille
live_updates.author: joeshread
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Mark McAdam:
Bournemouth
and
Marseille
have agreed a deal for midfielder
Hamed Traore
.
The deal is for a loan with an obligation to buy for nearly £6.5m plus add-ons.
Bournemouth have also negotiated a sell-on clause with Marseille.

live_updates.title: West Brom announce signing of Bournemouth's Mepham
live_updates.author: joeshread
live_updates.text:
West Brom
have announced the signing of
Chris Mepham
from
Bournemouth
.
Sky Sports News
understands the deal is worth up to £1.5m including add-ons.
Bonuses of £500,000 will be paid if West Brom secure promotion to the Premier League.

live_updates.title: Bournemouth's Winterburn set to leave on loan
live_updates.author: joeshread
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Peter Smith and Mark McAdam:
Bournemouth'
s
Ben Winterburn
is expected to leave on loan before Monday's transfer deadline.
The 20-year-old midfielder came on as a substitute in Bournemouth’s opening game of the season at Liverpool but the decision has been taken to give him more first-team experience.
Both the player and head coach
Andoni Iraola
are keen for him to go out on loan.
Winterburn has interest from a Scottish Premiership side and teams in League Two.

live_updates.title: Bournemouth in advanced talks for Jimenez
live_updates.author: Ron Walker
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Mark McAdam:
Bournemouth
are in advanced talks with
AC Milan
over the signing of right-back
Alex Jimenez.
The deal is for an initial loan that could become permanent at the end of the season.

live_updates.title: Bournemouth reject Palace's bid for Brooks
live_updates.author: Dominic Ball
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Kaveh Solhekol, Mark McAdam and James Savundra:
Bournemouth
have rejected a £4m bid from
Crystal Palace
for midfielder
David Brooks
.
The deal had add-ons that could have risen the fee to £8m.
Bournemouth’s stance is clear: the player is not for sale.
The 28-year-old has one year left on his current Bournemouth deal.

live_updates.title: REPORT: Brilliant Bournemouth beat shot-shy Spurs to inflict Frank's first PL loss
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Sky Sports' Declan Olley from the Tottenham Hotspur Stadium:
Thomas Frank suffered his first Premier League defeat as Spurs head coach after Bournemouth deservedly won 1-0 at the Tottenham Hotspur Stadium.

live_updates.title: Iraola: Brooks will stay amid Palace interest | 'We need a defender'
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Bournemouth
boss
Andoni Iraola
says they will "definitely" keep David Brooks amid interest from
Crystal Palace
.
He said: “We are going to keep David Brooks, yes, definitely.
"He’s started every game, he's playing very well, it's going to be a strong competition for everyone in every position but he's an important player for us and we are going to keep him.”
Iraola is now targeting signing another centre-back before the window closes on Monday.
The Spaniard said: “It's true that we probably miss this central defender that we need after signing Bafode (Diakite). We need [one] because we've lost Dean (Huijsen) and (Illia) Zabarnyi, so we need another central defender, but if not we still have options and we will deal with the situation, but it’s true that we are working on it.”

live_updates.title: Bournemouth agree deal for AC Milan defender Jimenez
live_updates.author: Richard Damerell
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Mark McAdam:
Bournemouth
have agreed a deal with
AC Milan
for defender
Alex Jimenez
.
It is an initial loan with an obligation to buy him.
The right-back is flying into the UK today to undergo a medical.

live_updates.title: Olympiakos in talks to sign Bournemouth striker Silcott-Duberry
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Dharmesh Sheth and Mark McAdam:
Olympiakos
are in talks with
Bournemouth
over a possible deal for
Zain Silcott-Duberry
.
The deal under discussion is a permanent move for the striker who joined Bournemouth in January this year.
The 20-year-old made one Premier League appearance last season.
Other teams from Europe have shown an interest in the player as well.

live_updates.title: Forest defender Carmo makes loan move
live_updates.author: Charlotte Marsh
live_updates.text:
Nottingham Forest
defender
David Carmo
is joining
Real Oviedo
on loan.
The deal also includes an option to make the deal permanent.
The Angola international joined Forest last summer but was spend last season on loan at Olympiakos.

live_updates.title: Marinakis: Everything is solid between me and Nuno
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Nottingham Forest
owner
Evangelos Marinakis
says “everything is solid” between himself and head coach
Nuno Espírito Santo
and they will talk this weekend.
“We have a solid relationship," said Marinakis about Nuno to TNT Sports.
"Sometimes we can be nervous, we can say one thing or another. What counts is the real relationship between me and Nuno, Nuno and the players and the players and ourselves. Everything is solid. We all want Nottingham to succeed.
“We are here in the good days, we are even closer in the difficult days. So personally, I don’t see a problem. I’m going to London today, over the weekend we’ll meet each other and I don’t see a problem at all. We’re together, united, we’ll make some corrective outcomes and everything will be smooth and ready to go.
“He has been successful. We have done things, we have enjoyed and now we can afford to do things we enjoy. As long as we enjoy it… we can go all the way in the Europa League. In the Premier League we need to work hard and have an even better run.”

live_updates.title: Savona completes Forest medical ahead of £11.25m move from Juventus
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky in Italy's Luca Bendoni and Sky Sports News' Lyall Thomas:
Juventus
defender
Nicolo Savona
has completed his
Nottingham Forest
medical ahead of his £11.25m move to the City Ground.
The right-back will sign a six-year deal at Forest.

live_updates.title: Botafogo goalkeeper Victor undergoing Forest medical
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Botafogo
goalkeeper
John Victor
was undergoing a medical with
Nottingham Forest
on Friday night.
The Brazilian is set to sign after the clubs agreed a deal earlier on Friday.
West Ham
had been very interested this summer and had another look at signing him earlier this week.

live_updates.title: Forest sign Juve defender Savona
live_updates.author: David Richardson
live_updates.text:
Nottingham Forest
have signed defender
Nicolo Savona
from
Juventus
for £11.25m.
The 22-year-old has signed a five-year deal.
Savona, a right-back who can also play at centre-back, had been with Juventus since the age of eight and made his first-team debut last August, going on to play 40 times.
He was called up to the Italy squad for the Nations League in November 2024.

live_updates.title: Hudson-Odoi signs new Nottingham Forest deal
live_updates.author: Callum Bishop
live_updates.text:
Callum Hudson-Odoi
has committed his future to
Nottingham Forest
by signing a new three-year contract at the club.
Hudson-Odoi, who joined Forest in 2023, has extended his stay until 2028.
A  fundamental part of the team that qualified for Europe in 2024/25,  Hudson-Odoi featured in 31 Premier League games and flourished under the  tutelage of Nuno Espirito Santo.
"This is home, and I’ve enjoyed every moment," the 24-year-old said.
"We have such an amazing group, and I can’t wait to keep going and enjoy the journey."

live_updates.title: Brazilians Victor and Cuaibano having Forest medicals
live_updates.author: Richard Damerell
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Lyall Thomas:
Nottingham Forest
are giving medicals to two Brazilians from
Botafogo
today.
Goalkeeper
John Victor
is completing his medical while left-back
Cuaibano
is beginning his.
Should the club tie up those deals before the deadline, Forest will have signed four players from Botafogo and five Brazilians.
Jair Cunha
and
Igor Jesus
arrived earlier in the window, while
Douglas Luiz
joined on an initial loan from Juventus last week.

live_updates.title: Forest confirm Dennis departure
live_updates.author: Richard Damerell
live_updates.text:
Nottingham Forest
have confirmed that
Emmanuel Dennis
has left the club following the mutual termination of his contract.
Dennis made 25 appearances for Forest after joining from Watford in August 2022.
The 27-year-old had loan spells at İstanbul Başakşehir and Watford during the 2023/24 season, spending the second half of the 2024/25 campaign on loan at Blackburn Rovers.

live_updates.title: Paris FC join race to sign Forest's Jota Silva
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky in Italy's Luca Bendoni:
Newly-promoted Ligue 1 side
Paris FC
have also joined the race for
Nottingham Forest
winger
Jota Silva
.
Sporting
also remain in talks, and the clubs are looking for a loan with an option to buy.
Forest, however, would prefer to sell Jota outright.

live_updates.title: Beard departs Burnley after two games in charge
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Matt Beard
has left his post as
Burnley
manager after two months and two league matches in charge.
“We are disappointed to confirm Matt Beard has resigned from his position to pursue other opportunities.
"The club’s search for Beard’s replacement is already under way,” Burnley said on Wednesday.
Beard departed from his second spell at Liverpool in February and was supposed to oversee a new period for Burnley, who have gone fully professional this season.
Burnley are third in FA WPL Premier Division with four points from their opening two games.

live_updates.title: Introducing... The Sky Sports WSL YouTube channel!
live_updates.author: Hayley Fox
live_updates.text:
Sky Sports
has launched its official
WSL YouTube channel
- your go-to destination for all things women's football. From match highlights and exclusive content to live games and behind-the-scenes action, this is where the WSL community comes together.

live_updates.title: Murphy signs new Man City deal
live_updates.author: Patrick Rowe
live_updates.text:
Manchester City
forward
Lily Murphy
has signed a contract extension with the WSL club to run until the summer of 2027.
The 19-year-old signed her first professional deal only last year.
Murphy featured 11 times in the WSL for City last season, starting in four of the appearances and registering one assist.

live_updates.title: London City Lionesses complete double transfer swoop
live_updates.author: Callum Bishop
live_updates.text:
London City Lionesses
have announced the double signing of
Katie Zelem
and
Alanna Kennedy
from
Angel City
ahead of their debut season in the WSL.
The England and Australia internationals have both previously enjoyed spells in England, with Kennedy at
Tottenham
and
Manchester City
and Zelem captaining
Manchester United
for four years, but now return after making the switch from the NWSL.
Zelem and Kennedy join other big-name signings at the club - including
Nikita Parris, Jana Fernandez
and
Danielle van de
Donk
ahead of London City Lionesses' first WSL season.

live_updates.title: Leicester sack Miquel
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Leicester
have sacked manager
Amandine Miquel
just 10 days before their first WSL match of the season against Man Utd.
Miquel had only been in charge for one season, guiding the Foxes to a 10th‑placed finish last term.
WSL fixtures in full
Assistant manager Amaury Messuwe has also left the club.
A statement released on Thursday read: "The squad continues its preparations under the wider coaching team ahead of the new WSL campaign, while we will provide a further update once the process of appointing a new LCFC Women manager has been concluded."

live_updates.title: Chelsea make move for Thompson
live_updates.author: Charlotte Marsh
live_updates.text:
Chelsea
have made a move for the
Angel City
winger
Alyssa Thompson
, according to
the Guardian.
The WSL club are hoping to reach a deal before the transfer window closes next Thursday.
The 20-year-old has eight goal involvements in her 16 NWSL appearances so far this season.
Chelsea begin their latest WSL title defence against Man City on Friday September 5, live on
Sky Sports.

live_updates.title: Davies pens first pro deal at Man City Women
live_updates.author: Charlotte Marsh
live_updates.text:
Mayzee Davies
has signed her first professional contract with
Man City Women.
The 19-year-old joins recent Girls’ Academy graduates Gracie Prior, Lily Murphy and Codie Thomas, who signed their first professional contracts in 2024.
The Welsh defender was a regular in first team matchday squads last season and has also earned five senior caps for Wales.

live_updates.title: Raso makes Frankfurt switch
live_updates.author: Charlotte Marsh
live_updates.text:
Hayley Raso
to join
Eintracht Frankfurt Women
on a permanent basis from
Tottenham Hotspur Women.
The Australia international spent a season with the club after joining last summer, making 16 appearances across all competitions.

live_updates.title: Symonds named new Brighton captain
live_updates.author: Charlotte Marsh
live_updates.text:
Maisie Symonds
has been named as
Brighton Women
captain for the 2025/26 season.
The 22-year-old joined the Seagulls in 2021 and has gone on to make 74 appearances for the club. She received her first Lionesses call-up last season.
She said: “It's a really nice feeling to know that the people you work with and respect have that belief in you.
“To be the captain is a massive role, I feel overwhelmed with happiness at the moment.
“There is a lot of experienced players within the squad and I'm sure I will continue to lean on them, not only me but every single member of the squad. Everyone will lead in different moments; everyone will have to pick each other up. Everyone has a different role to play but I'm really looking forward to the challenge."

live_updates.title: Man Utd progress in Champions League
live_updates.author: Callum Bishop
live_updates.text:
Elisabeth Terland
fired
Manchester United
into the third
Champions League
qualifying round with a hard-fought 1-0 victory over
Hammarby
in Stockholm.
It was a much tougher and more physical affair from their 4-0 victory over PSV in Wednesday's semi-final of the second-round mini tournament in Sweden.
Terland, who scored a hat-trick in that contest, finally broke the deadlock in the 61st minute, teed up by Melvine Malard's fine work for the assist.
Marc Skinner's side will learn their opponents for the two-legged third round, set to be played on 11 and 18 September, in Sunday's draw.
That round will decide who will advance to the new 18-club league phase, while Hammarby are guaranteed a place in the inaugural Europa Cup.
Ellen Wangerheim could not find the finishing touch with a good early chance for Hammarby, moments after Terland called Melina Loeck into a save.
Sofia Reidy came even closer for the Swedish side, catching the underside of the crossbar with an effort just before the half hour, before Loeck plucked out an effort from United summer signing Julia Zigiotti.
There were chances for Celin Bizet Donnum and Malard to find a breakthrough after the restart before a fine move from the latter finally facilitated Terland's opener.
The France international pulled the ball down at the back post, then across the face of goal to Terland, who cleverly tucked it past the sprawling Loeck.
United piled on the pressure as they looked to pad their lead, and Ella Toone forced Loeck into an alert save with a sharp effort.
The English side dug deep as Hammarby enjoyed a bright spell late on and clung on for victory, dampened slightly when Malard was forced off - Skinner will hope as a precaution - late on, after sustaining a head knock.

live_updates.title: Le Bris offers Ballard injury update
live_updates.author: Patrick Rowe
live_updates.text:
Sunderland
boss
Regis Le Bris
offered an update on
Dan Ballard's
injury.
The centre-back was forced off in the ninth minute of the 2-0 loss to Burnley at Turf Moor with what appeared to be a groin injury.
When asked for an update after the defeat, Le Bris said:
"He is always really important. We will wait until Monday for a diagnosis. It was a groin injury."
The Sunderland boss was then asked whether the injury would influence their decision-making in the transfer window before it closes on September 1.
Le Bris added: "It is not only connected with the injury. We have our plans and ways we want to build the squad.
"We don't have many signatures to do, there are two specific areas."

live_updates.title: Promoted sides showing fight to stay up
live_updates.author: Patrick Rowe
live_updates.text:
Sky Sports' Patrick Rowe:
It took until October for all three promoted sides to win a game in the Premier League last season. This season, it has only taken two weeks.
Burnley, Sunderland and Leeds United have already won half as many home games as last Ipswich, Leicester and Southampton last season, too.
It is early days for the newly-promoted trio but all three teams are showing the bravery, determination and quality to secure points in the top-flight.
Whether or not they can maintain this momentum throughout the course of the entire season remains to be seen. However, the early signs are promising.
All three promoted teams dropped back into the Championship last season - that might not be the case this time round.

live_updates.title: Dutch side interested in signing Seelt from Sunderland
live_updates.author: Patrick Rowe
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Keith Downie and Zinny Boswell:
Dutch club
NEC Nijmegen
are interested in signing
Sunderland
centre-back Jenson Seelt on loan before the deadline.
Sunderland are yet to decide on if they want to let the 22-year-old go.
Seelt has featured in both of Sunderland's Premier League matches so far this season.
NEC Nijmegen are currently top of the Eredivisie after winning all three of their opening games.
Seelt replaced Dan Ballard during the 2-0 loss to Burnley last weekend after the latter went off injured in the ninth minute.

live_updates.title: Sunderland make new offer for Bologna's Lucumi
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Keith Downie:
Sunderland
have made a new offer to
Bologna
for defender
Jhon Lucumi.
The Premier League new boys have offered £24m to the Italian side.
The Colombian international is open to the move.

live_updates.title: Rigg pens new Sunderland deal
live_updates.author: William Bitibiri
live_updates.text:
Chris Rigg
has signed a new long-term contract at
Sunderland
, extending his stay on Wearside until 2030.
The 18-year-old made 45 appearances in the Championship last season as Sunderland returned to the Premier League, also featuring in the play-off final at Wembley Stadium.
A graduate from Sunderland's academy, the midfielder was named Championship Apprentice of the Year for his efforts last campaign.

live_updates.title: Isidor: Sunderland fans best in the country
live_updates.author: Callum Bishop
live_updates.text:
"I'm just over the moon. I have no words. The last 24 hours I was rushing around - I didn't sleep."
"My baby daughter was born and today I scored the winner!"
"It's probably the biggest I've ever felt in my life."
"We have the best fans in England. They were sending me so many messages congratulating me yesterday - my best answer was [my goal] today!"

live_updates.title: Report: Super-sub Wilson Isidor scores 95th-minute winner for Black Cats
live_updates.author: Callum Bishop
live_updates.text: Wilson Isidor was the hero at the Stadium of Light as an impressive Sunderland came from behind to snatch a late 2-1 victory against Brentford.

live_updates.title: Le Bris: Fans made the difference
live_updates.author: Callum Bishop
live_updates.text:
Sunderland
manager
Regis Le Bris
was thrilled with both his team's performance and the atmosphere at the Stadium of Light after his team made it two home wins out of two against Brentford.
“I am happy and we went until the end," Le Bris said. “We tried to win this game and it was really positive, the way we managed the game with two different halves."
"Our fans feel the effect they can have on the game - they can generate that extra energy just to push the ball into the back of the net."
“Fine margins are everywhere, so if you can give this extra high energy then you can change the momentum - and that was the case today."
The Frenchman was quick to praise the attitude of midfielder
Enzo Le Fee
, who made his first Premier League start.
"Enzo was a bit disappointed that he didn’t start in either of our first two games, but he worked hard when he came on and today he started and showed his commitment to score and get an assist."
Although the early signs are promising for Sunderland, Le Bris isn't getting carried away.
"We made some mistakes and were punished. Today was really positive. But we have to learn quickly - that is the request of this league."

live_updates.title: Report: Fernandes rescues Man Utd as they scrape past Burnley
live_updates.author: William Bitibiri
live_updates.text:
Bruno Fernandes
scored a dramatic 96th-minute penalty as
Manchester United
scraped past
Burnley
3-2 in a game that
Ruben Amorim
had called a "must win".

live_updates.title: Merse: Give Man Utd full credit
live_updates.author: Patrick Rowe
live_updates.text:
Sky Sports' Paul Merson speaking on Soccer Saturday:
"I give Man Utd full credit. It didn't help with Cunha going off injured; he did walk off but was shaking his head. Mount also went off, surely injured. That is a problem.
"They just didn't put Burnley to bed. It could have been seven or eight, their goalkeeper [Martin Duvravka] was very good."

live_updates.title: Amorim: I knew Bruno would score
live_updates.author: Lewis Jones
live_updates.text:
Ruben Amorim speaking to Sky Sports:
"Is it really important? In the future, we are going to find out.
"These three points, I think, if you look at the game, we should solve the game right in the first half and then control the game. But it's never easy.
"We have to try to fight until the last minute, things that we overcomplicate. But for me, the most important thing is that it doesn't matter what happens, we try. During the game, we try in every moment, sometimes playing well, sometimes playing too open, too fast, losing possessions.
"But the effort was there.
"I think if you look at the first half, we have so many chances to score a goal and then that can help us to control the emotions, the game, to involve the fans.
"But we are always doing this and then you have the feeling you can control the game and I think you control it well. But then one throw in, one set-piece in this moment is really hard for us. But I was shaking my head because sometimes things are really easy.
"I don't like to see penalties, but I like to see the image of the fans. But I was just thinking sometimes one moment can change a lot of things.
"But in that moment I just was thinking that it's fair to win this game. I was not expecting Bruno to miss two penalties in a row. So I was really confident."

live_updates.title: Chelsea sign Garnacho from Man Utd
live_updates.author: Zinny Boswell
live_updates.text:
Chelsea have signed winger Alejandro Garnacho in a £40m transfer from Manchester United.
They have now spent nearly £300m on nine new arrivals this summer - but have a positive net spend as things stand after recouping more than £314m in sales.
Garnacho, 21, has signed a long-term deal at Chelsea and says he is happy to be joining "the best team in the world".
A compromise over Garnacho's valuation had to be reached as United valued him at £50m, which was more than Chelsea were prepared to pay.
United negotiated the fee up from an initial Chelsea offer of £25m and are understood to feel it is a good, pragmatic deal, delivering their largest sale fee for five years. They also believe it is a good solution for the player, who has been pushing strongly to leave.
The deal, which includes a 10 per cent sell-on fee, represents the fourth-largest sale in United's history after those of Cristiano Ronaldo, Romelu Lukaku and Angel Di Maria - and the club's largest sale of an academy graduate.

live_updates.title: Amorim: We need Cunha and Mount really bad to be competitive
live_updates.author: William Bitibiri
live_updates.text:
Ruben Amorim
says that
Manchester United
need both
Mason Mount
and
Matheus Cunha
really bad to be competitive after admitting his concerns over their respective injuries.
Both were withdrawn as United picked up their first win of the new season after Bruno Fernandes' late penalty helped United beat Burnley 3-2.
Cunha went straight down the tunnel, midway throught the first half, appearing to clutch his hamstring. Mount didn't emerge for the second half with Kobbie Mainoo replacing him during the break.
Asked for an injury update, Amorim said:
"I don't know [what their injuries were]. We will check them. We need those guys really bad. We need them to be really competitive.”
Amorim also offered an explanation as to why after starting in midweek, summer signing
Benjamin Sesko
started from the bench.
Sesko started the penalty shootout defeat to Grimsby also taking part in the penalty shootout. After questions were raised due to Sesko taking United's 10th penalty on the night, Amorim revealed the 22-year-old had been suffering with cramp after completing his first 90 minutes of the season.
"Everything is connected," Amorim said.
"So he finished the game with cramps, really in the limit. That's why we protected Ben from the penalties. And today was that reason also, because Josh is also a striker, he's an international striker.
"But I was thinking that Ben, during the pre-season, he didn't do 90 minutes.
"And he did that, even against a four-division team, he did that on Wednesday. And with the problem of Cunha, you don't know if that full game in the middle of the week has something to do with the injury today.
"With the problem with Mason Mount, I was not risking another player, not knowing if they are able to play so many minutes.
"So everything was connected."

live_updates.title: Hojlund arrives in Italy ahead of Napoli move
live_updates.author: Callum Bishop
live_updates.text:
Rasmus Hojlund
has arrived in Rome ahead of a loan move to
Napoli.
The Danish striker is expected to undergo a medical on Sunday.
Hojlund   is set to join on an initial loan with a conditional obligation that   will be triggered if Napoli qualify for the Champions League.
The total package is understood to be worth a potential £43m, including the loan fee.
Loan fee is more than £5m (€6m) and the obligation price is £38m (€44m).

live_updates.title: 'Man Utd make new approach for Villa goalkeeper Martinez'
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Manchester United
have made a new approach for
Aston Villa
goalkeeper
Emiliano Martinez
, according to
Fabrizio Romano
.
It is claimed Man Utd have held fresh talks with Villa and the World Cup winners' camp.
Negotiations reportedly remain ongoing for
Royal Antwerp
goalkeeper
Senne Lammens,
but Man Utd want to be ready if a deal collapses before the window shuts on Monday.

live_updates.title: Paqueta starts for West Ham amid Villa interest
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Aston Villa
target
Lucas Paqueta
starts for
West Ham
at
Nottingham Forest
.
Sky Sports News
reported this morning that West Ham do not want to sell the Brazil international to Aston Villa, or anyone else, before the deadline.
Villa have shown interest in an initial loan deal with an obligation to buy him worth a total package of around £50m.
The Hammers, however, want to keep the midfielder in their squad after a difficult start to the campaign.

live_updates.title: Olympiakos in talks to sign Bournemouth striker Silcott-Duberry
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Dharmesh Sheth and Mark McAdam:
Olympiakos
are in talks with
Bournemouth
over a possible deal for
Zain Silcott-Duberry
.
The deal under discussion is a permanent move for the striker who joined Bournemouth in January this year.
The 20-year-old made one Premier League appearance last season.
Other teams from Europe have shown an interest in the player as well.

live_updates.title: Akanji and Ederson on Man City bench amid transfer interest
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Manuel Akanji
is on the bench for
Manchester City
against Brighton, live on
Sky Sports
.
The defender has been the subject of interest from
Galatasaray
and
AC Milan
.
Sky in Italy
are reporting that Milan received little encouragement that he wanted to join and appear to have moved on.
The Switzerland international was not in the squad for the defeat to Spurs last weekend.
Goalkeeper
James Trafford
retains his starting spot ahead of
Ederson
, who is on the bench and is a
Galatasaray
target.

live_updates.title: 'Chelsea not playing poker with Bayern over Jackson'
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' chief correspondent Kaveh Solhekol:
Talks are going on right now between
Chelsea
and
Bayern Munich
about
Nicolas Jackson
.
Chelsea’s position is clear: Jackson is a Chelsea player, so if you want him, then buy him.
This is not a bluff; Chelsea are not playing poker.
Even if Bayern were to agree to sign Jackson, Chelsea would still have to sign a replacement - but there are hardly any strikers available on loan anymore.
Chelsea believe the loan agreement has now been totally revoked.
If Bayern believe in Jackson, they have to buy him.

live_updates.title: Leverkusen defender Hincapie travelling to London for Arsenal medical
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Dharmesh Sheth:
Bayer Leverkusen
defender
Piero Hincapie
is travelling to London ahead of undergoing a medical with
Arsenal
.
The two clubs have agreed a season-long loan deal which includes an option to buy.
Including the loan fee, the total package is worth £45m if Arsenal sign the 23-year-old permanently.
The Ecuador international has agreed a five-year contract at Arsenal if the option is triggered.

live_updates.title: Fulham remain in talks for AC Milan winger Chukwueze
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Lyall Thomas:
Fulham
still want to sign a second winger after
Kevin
and remain in talks for AC Milan’s
Samuel Chukwueze
.
The 26-year-old is a long-term target, and Fulham made offers for the Nigeria international in January.
Fulham also admire
Dilane Bakwa
– a player
Nottingham Forest
are in talks for – but Chukwueze is thought to be the priority.
Fulham have also been interested in
Arsenal
winger
Reiss Nelson
, who also remains a target for
Crystal Palace
, and potentially
Chelsea
forward
Raheem Sterling
on loan.

live_updates.title: Paris FC join race to sign Forest's Jota Silva
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky in Italy's Luca Bendoni:
Newly-promoted Ligue 1 side
Paris FC
have also joined the race for
Nottingham Forest
winger
Jota Silva
.
Sporting
also remain in talks, and the clubs are looking for a loan with an option to buy.
Forest, however, would prefer to sell Jota outright.

live_updates.title: Forest set for busy Deadline Day
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Anton Toloui from the City Ground:
It’ll be a busy day of departures at
Nottingham Forest
on Deadline Day tomorrow.
Jota Silva
and
Taiwo Anwoniyi
are not included in the matchday squad against West Ham, with Silva in talks with two clubs about a move away.
Omar Richards, Josh Bowler, Eric da Silva Moreira
and
Zach Abbott
are also expected to leave either temporarily or permanently.
As for
West Ham
,
Maxwel Cornet
is not in the squad at the City Ground and is the only senior player who could leave despite interest in playmaker
Lucas Paqueta
, who starts against Forest.

live_updates.title: Ex-Man Utd boss Ten Hag's Leverkusen future already under threat
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
There is a chance ex-
Manchester United
boss
Erik ten Hag
could lose his job already at
Bayer Leverkusen
.
Sky in Germany
are reporting that Leverkusen’s management are meeting to discuss whether Ten Hag will be able to build a team following their transfer business.
Sky in Germany
report that a decision is not expected before Deadline Day, but a quick parting of the ways is quite possible at the beginning of the new week.
The Dutchman has been accused internally of lacking a clear, game-planning approach and of bringing too little structure to his game.
Furthermore, the team is reporting that his pre-match communication and presentations are poor. For example, he didn't even give a proper motivational speech before the home defeat to Hoffenheim – much to the team's surprise.
If Ten Hag was to be sacked by Bayer Leverkusen, he would become the third ex-Man Utd boss to lose his job recently, following the dismissals of
Ole Gunnar Solskjaer
– who lost his job at Besiktas three days ago – and
Jose Mourinho
, who left Fenerbahce on Friday.

live_updates.title: Man Utd attacker Williams joins Falkirk on loan
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Scottish Premiership side
Falkirk
have completed the season-long loan signing of attacker
Ethan Williams
from
Manchester United.

live_updates.title: Leicester want to sign Palace winger Rak-Sakyi on loan
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Rob Dorsett:
Leicester
want to sign
Jesurun Rak-Sakyi
on loan from
Crystal Palace
before the deadline.
Palace are reluctant to let the winger go without a replacement.
The 22-year-old has two years left on his contract at Palace.

live_updates.title: Celtic striker Idah in Wales as he closes in on £7m move to Swansea
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Anthony Joseph:
Celtic
striker
Adam Idah
is in Wales under going the second part of his medical ahead of a £7m move to
Swansea City
.
The Republic of Ireland international travelled last night and was not in Celtic’s squad for their 0-0 draw with Rangers at Ibrox.
Idah is expected to finalise his move, with Celtic making continued progress in talks for
Anderlecht
forward
Kasper Dolberg
.
Sky Sports News
understands Celtic and Swansea have agreed an initial fee of £6m, plus more than £1m in add-ons.
Idah completed the first part of his medical with Swansea on Friday and agreed personal terms.
He was then called back by Celtic after the Hoops struggled to reach an agreement for Dolberg by close of play that day.
Celtic are looking to sign two strikers before tomorrow’s 11pm deadline in Scotland.

live_updates.title: Hojlund completes Napoli medical ahead of move from Man Utd
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Dharmesh Sheth and Sky in Italy:
Rasmus Hojlund
has completed his medical ahead of his move from
Manchester United
to
Napoli
.
The deal is a loan plus a conditional obligation worth £43m (€50m).

live_updates.title: Talks still open between Betis and Man Utd over Antony deal
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Dharmesh Sheth:
Dialogue remains open between
Real Betis
and
Manchester United
over the signing of
Antony
.
A deal was agreed on Friday – only for Betis to pull out, stating they could not afford it on the current terms.
Willingness from all parties to complete the move and still a cautious optimism that a deal can be struck.
The impasse centres on how Antony’s compensation for the remaining two years of his contract is paid.
The move might also require Antony to compromise on his personal terms, something United feel he should be able to do given he has rebuffed a number of offers in favour of a return to Betis.

live_updates.title: Lammens and Martinez keen on joining Man Utd as club weigh up goalkeeper options
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News Dharmesh Sheth, Vik Varange and Rob Dorsett:
Internal discussions continue at
Manchester United
over their next steps regarding signing a goalkeeper.
It is understood
Royal Antwerp's
Senne Lammens
and
Aston Villa’s
Emiliano Martinez
are both keen on a move to Old Trafford.
Martinez has had offers but is thought he is waiting on United.
One source has told
Sky Sports News
that United have explored the conditions of a deal for the World Cup winner.
Talks continue with Royal Antwerp over Lammens.
Galatasaray are also pushing, and United will not get drawn into a bidding war.
Both potential deals are thought to be complicated given the time left in the window, and there is still a chance United will not sign a keeper before the deadline.

live_updates.title: Mainz make improved £3m offer for Sturm Graz's Boving
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Anthony Joseph:
Mainz
have made an improved offer of £3m for
Sturm Graz
forward
William Boving
.
It is understood negotiations are progressing well, but they could face late competition from Girona and other Bundesliga clubs.
A number of English Championship clubs have been interested in Boving but are yet to make an offer.

live_updates.title: West Ham in talks to sign Victor - transfer shortlist also revealed
live_updates.author: Patrick Rowe
live_updates.text:
West Ham
are back in talks to sign
Botafogo
goalkeeper
John Victor
,
Sky Sports News
understands.
They are understood to be discussing an initial loan that could become permanent if he manages to establish himself as their No 1.
The fee for the permanent aspect could be £6m, as West Ham look for more competition in goal following a disastrous start.
Victor is understood to be willing to make the move, despite being left
disappointed
that West Ham opted to sign
Mads Hermansen
from Leicester instead earlier in the window, and he fancies his chances of becoming their first-choice goalkeeper.
Hermansen conceded eight goals in his first two Premier League games, while
Alphonse Areola
shipped in three in the EFL Cup defeat at Wolves last night.
West Ham are looking to sign multiple players before the deadline, including more than one midfielder.
Soungoutou Magassa
was scheduled to arrive in the UK on Wednesday to undergo a medical with West Ham ahead of a £17.3m move from
Monaco
.
West Ham have also approached
Nottingham Forest
about initially loaning
Ibrahim Sangare
.
Other midfielders of interest include
Strasbourg's Junior Mwanga, Middlesbrough’s Hayden Hackney, Southampton’s Mateus Fernandes
and
Bayer Leverkusen’s Aleix Garcia.
West Ham are one of three London clubs interested in
Raheem Sterling
on loan along with
Fulham
and
Crystal Palace.
Reports claim
Everton
have bid for
Tomas Soucek,
while there could be late interest in
Lucas Paqueta
.
Marseille
are in talks over the signing of West Ham left-back
Emerson.

live_updates.title: Botafogo want higher price for Victor
live_updates.author: David Richardson
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Rob Dorsett:
Botafogo
currently want to agree a much higher fee than the £6m
West Ham
are prepared to pay for goalkeeper
John Victor
, if the loan becomes permanent.
The discussions at the start of the month, before the Hammers signed Mads Hermansen, centred around a bigger number.
Victor has no concerns about taking the loan option, believing he will be able to establish himself as the first-choice goalkeeper. He is very motivated by the idea of a move to the Premier League.
He was the Brazilian footballer of the year last season, and was one of only two goalkeepers to keep a clean sheet against Paris Saint-Germain.
West Ham are understood to be discussing an initial loan that could become permanent if he manages to establish himself as their No 1.

live_updates.title: West Ham agree Fernandes deal
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
West Ham
have agreed a £42m deal with
Southampton
for
Mateus Fernandes
.
The fee is broken up into a £38m guaranteed payment plus £4m in add-ons.
A medical is already under way.
The 21-year-old Portugal youth international will be West Ham’s sixth signing of the summer.
Fernandes joined Southampton in the summer of 2024 from Sporting CP and has since made 46 appearances.

live_updates.title: Two midfielders undergoing West Ham medicals
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Chris Reidy:
Soungouto Magassa
is currently undergoing his
West Ham United
medical.
West Ham have agreed a £17.3m deal with
Monaco
fore France U21 midfielder.
Mateus Fernandes
has also been undergoing a medical today.
West Ham agreed a deal worth £42m deal with
Southampton
for the midfielder.

live_updates.title: Potter: Fernandes gives us a different dimension
live_updates.author: Patrick Rowe
live_updates.text:
West Ham
boss
Graham Potter
has outlined how delighted the club are to secure the services of
Mateus Fernandes
.
The Hammers will pay an initial fee of £38m plus £4m in add-ons for the 21-year-old, who has signed a five-year deal at the club.
"Mateus is a young player who has made impressive progress in the early part of his career, and we are delighted to have secured his signing," said Potter in a statement from the club.
"He gained valuable experience in the Premier League last year with Southampton and is someone we really feel can help improve us and fit into what we are trying to build and develop at the club.
"We believe that his attributes and strengths will bring a different dimension to the squad and, from speaking to him, I know that he can't wait to get started here.
"He has shown great maturity and character for someone so young, and we look forward to seeing his continued progress and impact at West Ham United."

live_updates.title: West Ham confirm Fernandes signing
live_updates.author: Patrick Rowe
live_updates.text:
West Ham
have confirmed the signing of
Mateus Fernandes
from
Southampton.
The Hammers will pay an initial fee of £38m plus £4m in add-ons for the 21-year-old, who will be available to face Nottingham Forest on Sunday, live on Sky Sports.
Speaking in a statement released by the club, Fernandes said: “I'm very happy to be here. I'm very excited to play for West Ham. I think it's a big step for me.
“It's a big club, a massive club. The project, the stadium, the city, everything.
“I want to try to play football, enjoy football, not just run and try to score, but try to play good football.
“I think the most important thing is to try to give everything every day.”

live_updates.title: West Ham's biggest problem?
live_updates.author: Nick Wright
live_updates.text:
The Radar
column this week includes stats showing the glaring lack of pace undermining
Graham Potter
at
West Ham
.

live_updates.title: West Ham sign midfielder Magassa from Monaco
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
West Ham
have signed midfielder
Soungoutou Magassa
from
Monaco
in a £17.3m deal.
The France U21 international, who can also play at centre-back, has joined the Hammers on a long-term contract.
He said: “West Ham is a very big club, it has a long-standing history in England, with many supporters and a very big stadium. It wasn’t complicated to say ‘yes’.
“It's a dream to play for West Ham in the Premier League. It's the best league in the world. I'm going to do everything I can to show that I'm up to the task.
“It gives me great pride to play for this club. I’m really motivated, I hope to bring freshness and youth and I'm going to give my all on the pitch.”
Magassa's arrival follows the signing of fellow midfielder Mateus Fernandes from Southampton in a £42m deal.
West Ham boss Graham Potter said: “Like Mateus Fernandes, he is a young player who has made very impressive progress right at the start of his senior career.
“He has played regularly for Monaco over the past two seasons, including in the Champions League last year, and stood up really well to that test.
“Again, he has a range of attributes and qualities that we feel will complement what we already have at the club and also help to improve us.
“Soungoutou is a determined, hungry and focused young man – we are looking forward to working with him and excited to see him continue his development with us.”

live_updates.title: West Ham do not want to sell Paqueta amid Aston Villa interest
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' chief correspondent Kaveh Solhekol:
West Ham
do not want to sell
Lucas Paqueta
to
Aston Villa
, or anyone else, before the deadline, as the midfielder started for the Hammers at Nottingham Forest on Sunday.
Villa have shown interest in an initial loan deal with an obligation to buy him worth a total package of around £50m.
West Ham, however, want to keep Paqueta in their squad after a difficult start to the campaign.

Olympiakos
are in talks with
Bournemouth

Zain Silcott-Duberry

live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:

and remain in talks for AC Milan’s
