live_updates.title: Forest set for busy Deadline Day
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Anton Toloui from the City Ground:
It’ll be a busy day of departures at
Nottingham Forest
on Deadline Day tomorrow.
Jota Silva
and
Taiwo Anwoniyi
are not included in the matchday squad against West Ham, with Silva in talks with two clubs about a move away.
Omar Richards, Josh Bowler, Eric da Silva Moreira
and
Zach Abbott
are also expected to leave either temporarily or permanently.
As for
West Ham
,
Maxwel Cornet
is not in the squad at the City Ground and is the only senior player who could leave despite interest in playmaker
Lucas Paqueta
, who starts against Forest.

live_updates.title: Ex-Man Utd boss Ten Hag's Leverkusen future already under threat
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
There is a chance ex-
Manchester United
boss
Erik ten Hag
could lose his job already at
Bayer Leverkusen
.
Sky in Germany
are reporting that Leverkusen’s management are meeting to discuss whether Ten Hag will be able to build a team following their transfer business.
Sky in Germany
report that a decision is not expected before Deadline Day, but a quick parting of the ways is quite possible at the beginning of the new week.
The Dutchman has been accused internally of lacking a clear, game-planning approach and of bringing too little structure to his game.
Furthermore, the team is reporting that his pre-match communication and presentations are poor. For example, he didn't even give a proper motivational speech before the home defeat to Hoffenheim – much to the team's surprise.
If Ten Hag was to be sacked by Bayer Leverkusen, he would become the third ex-Man Utd boss to lose his job recently, following the dismissals of
Ole Gunnar Solskjaer
– who lost his job at Besiktas three days ago – and
Jose Mourinho
, who left Fenerbahce on Friday.

live_updates.title: Man Utd attacker Williams joins Falkirk on loan
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Scottish Premiership side
Falkirk
have completed the season-long loan signing of attacker
Ethan Williams
from
Manchester United.

live_updates.title: Leicester want to sign Palace winger Rak-Sakyi on loan
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Rob Dorsett:
Leicester
want to sign
Jesurun Rak-Sakyi
on loan from
Crystal Palace
before the deadline.
Palace are reluctant to let the winger go without a replacement.
The 22-year-old has two years left on his contract at Palace.

live_updates.title: Celtic striker Idah in Wales as he closes in on £7m move to Swansea
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Anthony Joseph:
Celtic
striker
Adam Idah
is in Wales under going the second part of his medical ahead of a £7m move to
Swansea City
.
The Republic of Ireland international travelled last night and was not in Celtic’s squad for their 0-0 draw with Rangers at Ibrox.
Idah is expected to finalise his move, with Celtic making continued progress in talks for
Anderlecht
forward
Kasper Dolberg
.
Sky Sports News
understands Celtic and Swansea have agreed an initial fee of £6m, plus more than £1m in add-ons.
Idah completed the first part of his medical with Swansea on Friday and agreed personal terms.
He was then called back by Celtic after the Hoops struggled to reach an agreement for Dolberg by close of play that day.
Celtic are looking to sign two strikers before tomorrow’s 11pm deadline in Scotland.

live_updates.title: Hojlund completes Napoli medical ahead of move from Man Utd
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Dharmesh Sheth and Sky in Italy:
Rasmus Hojlund
has completed his medical ahead of his move from
Manchester United
to
Napoli
.
The deal is a loan plus a conditional obligation worth £43m (€50m).

live_updates.title: Talks still open between Betis and Man Utd over Antony deal
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Dharmesh Sheth:
Dialogue remains open between
Real Betis
and
Manchester United
over the signing of
Antony
.
A deal was agreed on Friday – only for Betis to pull out, stating they could not afford it on the current terms.
Willingness from all parties to complete the move and still a cautious optimism that a deal can be struck.
The impasse centres on how Antony’s compensation for the remaining two years of his contract is paid.
The move might also require Antony to compromise on his personal terms, something United feel he should be able to do given he has rebuffed a number of offers in favour of a return to Betis.

live_updates.title: Lammens and Martinez keen on joining Man Utd as club weigh up goalkeeper options
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News Dharmesh Sheth, Vik Varange and Rob Dorsett:
Internal discussions continue at
Manchester United
over their next steps regarding signing a goalkeeper.
It is understood
Royal Antwerp's
Senne Lammens
and
Aston Villa’s
Emiliano Martinez
are both keen on a move to Old Trafford.
Martinez has had offers but is thought he is waiting on United.
One source has told
Sky Sports News
that United have explored the conditions of a deal for the World Cup winner.
Talks continue with Royal Antwerp over Lammens.
Galatasaray are also pushing, and United will not get drawn into a bidding war.
Both potential deals are thought to be complicated given the time left in the window, and there is still a chance United will not sign a keeper before the deadline.

live_updates.title: Mainz make improved £3m offer for Sturm Graz's Boving
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Anthony Joseph:
Mainz
have made an improved offer of £3m for
Sturm Graz
forward
William Boving
.
It is understood negotiations are progressing well, but they could face late competition from Girona and other Bundesliga clubs.
A number of English Championship clubs have been interested in Boving but are yet to make an offer.

live_updates.title: Emery: We have to perform with the players we have
live_updates.author: William Bitibiri
live_updates.text:
Unai Emery
suggests
Aston Villa
may have to prepare to continue with their current defensive options as the transfer window draws to a close.
Villa were beaten 1-0 at
Brentford
on Saturday, with Ezri Konsa suspended after picking up a red card in their opening draw vs Newcastle.
Emery's side have been linked to signing a defender to bolster options at the back.
However, asked about Konsa's absence affecting the team, Emery said:
"We have to be ready to play with the centre-backs we have.
"We have to perform with the players we have. I think it’s enough players to get enough performances for this season.
“But this week is the last week for the transfer window and of course, we have some circumstances that are not helping us.”

live_updates.title: 'Villa make contact for Nkunku'
live_updates.author: Patrick Rowe
live_updates.text:
Aston Villa
have made contact for
Chelsea
forward
Christopher Nkunku
, according to
Fabrizio Romano
.
The 27-year-old is reportedly an option for Unai Emery's side before the end of the season.
Bayern Munich and RB Leipzig are also interested in Nkunku.
Sky Sports News
reported earlier in August that Chelsea rejected a loan move offer from Bayern, with both the player and club wanting a permanent exit.
Chelsea value Nkunku, who has four years remaining on his current deal, at £43m.

live_updates.title: 'Villa reject Stuttgart loan offer for Buendia'
live_updates.author: David Bowers
live_updates.text:
Aston Villa have rejected Stuttgart's initial loan offer for Emiliano Buendia, according to
The Athletic
.
The offer also included an option to buy the midfielder who, according to the report, is weighing up a potential departure from Villa Park.
The 28-year-old - who is contracted to Villa until 2027 - spent the second half of 2024-25 on loan at Bundesliga side Bayer Leverkusen, who had an option to make the move permanent.
Buendia made 14 appearances for Leverkusen, starting four matches and scoring twice.

live_updates.title: Villa in talks for Asensio return
live_updates.author: Charlotte Marsh
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Kaveh Solhekol, Lyall Thomas and Sky Germany:
Aston Villa
are understood to be in talks with
Paris Saint-Germain
for
Marco Asensio.
The French club want a permanent deal for the Spain international, who only has one year left on his contract.
He was on loan at Villa last season and
Sky Sports News
have already reported Villa have been interested in signing him again.
Nicolas Jackson
remains another player Villa have an interest in before the deadline.

live_updates.title: Emery: We are very busy
live_updates.author: Adam Bate
live_updates.text:
Sky Sports' Adam Bate at Aston Villa's training ground:
Unai Emery
acknowledged that
Aston Villa
’s start to the season has been “poor” and does not expect it to get easier against a Crystal Palace side that has proven a tricky match-up for his side under Oliver Glasner.
The Villa boss is hoping to get some help in the next few days before the transfer window closes, however. “We are very busy. We are working here, we are active,” he said.
Asked by
Sky Sports
about the possibility of
Marco Asensio
returning, he added: “I don't want to speak about some players because we have different options. Of course, you are asking me about Marco Asensio, I was so happy with him [last season] in general.”

live_updates.title: Villa in talks for Dons' Boyd
live_updates.author: Charlotte Marsh
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Anthony Joseph and Lyall Thomas:
Aston Villa
are in talks to sign
Aberdeen
attacker midfielder
Fletcher Boyd.
It’s understood the Dons are looking for a fee in the region of £1m, plus add-ons - including a significant sell-on clause.
Villa have been tracking the 17-year-old for some time and made initial contact in June.
Sky Sports News
has been told that all parties are hopeful of reaching a deal before Monday’s transfer deadline.

live_updates.title: 'Man Utd make new approach for Villa goalkeeper Martinez'
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Manchester United
have made a new approach for
Aston Villa
goalkeeper
Emiliano Martinez
, according to
Fabrizio Romano
.
It is claimed Man Utd have held fresh talks with Villa and the World Cup winners' camp.
Negotiations reportedly remain ongoing for
Royal Antwerp
goalkeeper
Senne Lammens,
but Man Utd want to be ready if a deal collapses before the window shuts on Monday.

live_updates.title: West Ham do not want to sell Paqueta amid Aston Villa interest
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' chief correspondent Kaveh Solhekol:
West Ham
do not want to sell
Lucas Paqueta
to
Aston Villa
, or anyone else, before the deadline.
Villa have shown interest in an initial loan deal with an obligation to buy him worth a total package of around £50m.
West Ham, however, want to keep Paqueta in their squad after a difficult start to the campaign.
West Ham play away at Nottingham Forest today, live on
Sky Sports
.

live_updates.title: Aston Villa agree £1m deal for Aberdeen teenager Boyd
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Anthony Joseph:
Aston Villa
have agreed a £1m deal, plus add-ons, to sign
Aberdeen
attacking midfielder
Fletcher Boyd
.
It is understood that the deal includes a significant sell-on clause.
The 17-year-old is in Birmingham today and is due to undergo a medical before finalising the paperwork on a long-term contract.

live_updates.title: Aston Villa agree £1m deal for Aberdeen teenager Boyd
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Anthony Joseph:
Aston Villa
have agreed a £1m deal, plus add-ons, to sign
Aberdeen
attacking midfielder
Fletcher Boyd
.
It is understood that the deal includes a significant sell-on clause.
The 17-year-old is in Birmingham today and is due to undergo a medical before finalising the paperwork on a long-term contract.

live_updates.title: Chelsea pulling out of Jackson's move to Bayern
live_updates.author: Zinny Boswell
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' chief correspondent Kaveh Solhekol:
Chelsea are pulling out of the Nicolas Jackson loan deal to Bayern Munich.
Bayern have been informed that Chelsea will not be able to proceed with the proposed deal due to an injury to Liam Delap against Fulham.
The decision to cancel Jackson’s loan was taken after discussions this afternoon between Chelsea’s football leadership team and head coach Enzo Maresca.
The player is now expected to return to London. He will go straight back into the first-team squad.
He has been training with the first-team squad as there was always the possibility he would stay.
He signed an extension last September and his contract runs to 2033.

live_updates.title: Chelsea submit bid for Barca star
live_updates.author: Zinny Boswell
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' chief correspondent Kaveh Solhekol:
Chelsea have sent Barcelona a £36.6m (€40m) written bid for Fermin Lopez.
They are now waiting for a response after submitting the offer today.
Sky Sports News
has been reporting that Chelsea would make an offer if they received any encouragement that a deal was possible.

live_updates.title: Chelsea sign Garnacho from Man Utd
live_updates.author: Zinny Boswell
live_updates.text:
Chelsea have signed winger Alejandro Garnacho in a £40m transfer from Manchester United.
They have now spent nearly £300m on nine new arrivals this summer - but have a positive net spend as things stand after recouping more than £314m in sales.
Garnacho, 21, has signed a long-term deal at Chelsea and says he is happy to be joining "the best team in the world".
A compromise over Garnacho's valuation had to be reached as United valued him at £50m, which was more than Chelsea were prepared to pay.
United negotiated the fee up from an initial Chelsea offer of £25m and are understood to feel it is a good, pragmatic deal, delivering their largest sale fee for five years. They also believe it is a good solution for the player, who has been pushing strongly to leave.
The deal, which includes a 10 per cent sell-on fee, represents the fourth-largest sale in United's history after those of Cristiano Ronaldo, Romelu Lukaku and Angel Di Maria - and the club's largest sale of an academy graduate.

live_updates.title: Jackson to return to Chelsea
live_updates.author: Callum Bishop
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' chief correspondent Kaveh Solhekol:
Nicolas Jackson
has to come back to
Chelsea
.
Nothing was signed with
Bayern Munich
and there is no paperwork.
He was given permission to travel and have a medical and that permission has been revoked.
Chelsea   have a good working relationship with Bayern – this situation may have   been different if this was a permanent deal but Bayern insisted on a   loan.
This is a unique and awkward situation but the expectation is that everyone is going to act professionally.
If   this was a permanent deal, Chelsea would be able to use the fee   received to buy another forward – but it is not, and in any case, there   are very strikers available in the market at the moment.
Bayern   could try to change the deal to a permanent move, but time is running   out and potential replacements are scarce. Bayern have made it clear   they are only in the market for loans.
It’s  understandable the player is disappointed – he was hoping to become the  heir to
Harry Kane
, but he is a Chelsea player and is contracted until  2033.
Bayern   have been informed that Chelsea have no intention of loaning the  player  and he has been asked to return. The permission to have a  medical has  been revoked.
Meanwhile, Chelsea are waiting for a response from Barcelona about their €40m bid for
Fermin Lopez
.

live_updates.title: Bayern director speaks out on Jackson saga
live_updates.author: Callum Bishop
live_updates.text:
Bayern's sporting director Max Eberl speaking with Sky in Germany:
"Chelsea has informed us that they would like to have the player back – after we came to an agreement yesterday and we were given permission for the medical.
"Now the situation is that the boy is in Munich and we have to send him back. That is the current state of affairs; I cannot predict the future."

live_updates.title: Papers: Furious Jackson refusing to return to Chelsea after Bayern loan snub
live_updates.author: William Bitibiri
live_updates.text: The top stories and transfer rumours from Sunday's newspapers...

live_updates.title: Jackson still in Munich with Chelsea striker not giving up on Bayern move
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' chief correspondent Kaveh Solhekol:
Chelsea
striker
Nicolas Jackson
is still in Munich on Sunday morning and has not given up hope of his move to
Bayern Munich
still going ahead.
Chelsea would have a decision to make if Bayern offered an obligation to buy or a permanent deal.
The German champions' current deal for Jackson would see them pay a £13m up-front loan fee with a £56.2m option to buy.
Chelsea are pulling out of the deal due to an injury picked up by
Liam Delap
in the win over Fulham.
The Blues have asked Jackson to return from Germany, where he was progressing a loan move to Bayern.
The decision to cancel Jackson’s loan was taken after discussions on Saturday afternoon between Chelsea’s football leadership team and head coach
Enzo Maresca
.
Bayern have been informed that Chelsea will not be able to proceed with the proposed deal.

live_updates.title: Chelsea in talks with Sporting over striker Harder as Jackson pushes for Bayern move
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' chief correspondent Kaveh Solhekol and Zinny Boswell:
Chelsea
striker
Nicolas Jackson
is still in Munich this morning and has not given up hope of his move to Bayern still going ahead.
The situation would change if Bayern were prepared to buy Jackson or take him on loan, plus an obligation to buy instead of just an option.
That is a solution that Chelsea would consider, but they would need to bring in another striker, and time is running out with very few options available.
Chelsea are in talks with
Sporting
for striker
Conrad Harder
.
RB Leipzig
and
AC Milan
have been trying to sign the 20-year-old from the Portuguese club this summer.
Meanwhile, Jackson is in Munich and wants to sign for Bayern.
Chelsea have revoked the permission they gave for him to have a medical and have asked him to return.

live_updates.title: 'Chelsea not playing poker with Bayern over Jackson'
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' chief correspondent Kaveh Solhekol:
Talks are going on right now between
Chelsea
and
Bayern Munich
about
Nicolas Jackson
.
Chelsea’s position is clear: Jackson is a Chelsea player, so if you want him, then buy him.
This is not a bluff; Chelsea are not playing poker.
Even if Bayern were to agree to sign Jackson, Chelsea would still have to sign a replacement - but there are hardly any strikers available on loan anymore.
Chelsea believe the loan agreement has now been totally revoked.
If Bayern believe in Jackson, they have to buy him.

live_updates.title: Bees in talks for Beier as potential Wissa replacement
live_updates.author: Peter Smith
live_updates.text:
Brentford
are in talks with
Borussia Dortmund
over a deal for
Max Beier
as they seek a replacement for
Yoane
Wissa
.
Wissa still believes he will get his dream move to Newcastle before the window closes.
But the Beier deal is not an easy one to do - so there is still no guarantee Wissa will leave yet.
With so little time remaining,
Newcastle
are working on another move for Wissa behind the scenes.
They want to be ready to act, if and when they get the green light.
One source has told
Sky Sports News
the situation could go into the final hours of the window.
Wissa will not be involved again for Brentford this weekend, head coach Keith Andrews confirmed on Thursday.

live_updates.title: Brentford make £45m bid for Dortmund's Beier
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Exclusive from Sky Sports News' Lyall Thomas:
Brentford
have made a bid in the region of £45m for
Borussia Dortmund’s Max Beier.
It is on the table and now down to Dortmund to make a decision.

live_updates.title: Brentford moving on to other targets after Beier bid rejected
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Lyall Thomas:
Brentford
have had a £45m bid rejected by
Borussia Dortmund
for forward
Max Beier.
As a result, Brentford are now moving on to other targets,
Sky Sports News
understands.
Meanwhile,
Newcastle
target
Yoane Wissa
is no closer to knowing what his future holds.

live_updates.title: Andrews: Schade is not to blame
live_updates.author: Callum Bishop
live_updates.text:
Keith Andrews
was quick to defend
Kevin Schade
after the
Brentford
attacker missed a penalty in their defeat to Sunderland.
Schade's decision to take the penalty raised questions after Igor Thiago, who scored a penalty last week, appeared to step aside.
"Bryan [Mbuemo] was the penalty taker since Ivan [Toney] left the building – it's something we’ve been conscious of for a while. We've worked on it a lot in training.
"I don’t put any blame on Kevin for missing the penalty – he's been outstanding since the start of pre-season."
Andrews was complimentary of his team despite the defeat, praising the squad's commitment despite upheaval at the club.
"The goal at the end was hard to swallow.
It’s been a difficult pre-season – the amount of changes has been tough, but everyone today has been absolutely committed."

live_updates.title: Brentford in talks for Veerman
live_updates.author: Charlotte Marsh
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Lyall Thomas:
Brentford
are in talks with
PSV
over the signing of
Joey Veerman.
He is a central midfielder, so unrelated to
Yoane Wissa's
predicament.
PSV are very reluctant to sell Veerman.

live_updates.title: Newcastle target Wissa demands Bees exit in bombshell statement
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Newcastle
target
Yoane Wissa
has sensationally demanded to be sold by
Brentford
before the summer transfer window closes on Monday.
Newcastle have had multiple offers rejected for Wissa this summer, and the striker has taken to Instagram to reveal his frustrations at a move not materialising as he pushes for a switch to the Magpies before Monday's 7pm deadline.
Brentford are not commenting on Wissa's bombshell statement.
Sky Sports News
has also not seen evidence of the written assurances Wissa speaks of in his statement.

live_updates.title: Brentford set to end pursuit of PSV's Veerman
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Lyall Thomas:
Brentford
are unlikely to continue their pursuit of
PSV Eindhoven
midfielder
Joey Veerman
.
The clubs have so far been unable to agree a valuation, and PSV want to keep him.
Brentford are still assessing targets, including left-wing, with less than 48 hours remaining.

live_updates.title: Newcastle must meet Wissa valuation and Bees need replacement for striker to move
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Lyall Thomas:
Brentford
have been willing to engage with
Newcastle
over
Yoane Wissa
, but his valuation must be met, and they want to replace him.
The Bees are yet to sign a replacement –
Dango Ouattara
was the replacement for
Bryan Mbeumo
.
They tried for
Max Beier
but were unable to agree a fee with
Borussia Dortmund
.
They will continue to work hard in the market and are assessing other targets with less than 48 hours to go.
Brentford have rejected two bids from Newcastle for Wissa so far this summer; one worth £25m and the second worth £40m.
